title: Central Garden & Pet: Niche Focus, Big Growth Potential
text: Kind: captions Language: en now let's move on to your last pick of the day Chris what are you going with so this is a company that quite honestly Bridget it was new to me it's called Central Garden and Pet and the uh the ticker symbol is senta c n ta very simple company business model in terms of if you just look at the name they have two business verticals one is Garden supplies one is pet supplies um they interestingly I noticed they don't really it from what I saw on their website they don't really get into the pet food area a lot it's more of the the treats and the toys and other peripheral items that pet owners might have but what I did notice is they've noticed that the pet their pet business is very strong because of the um the willingness of consumers to pay a premium to keep their pets happy and healthy and the Garden business is doing well and so it seems to me that you've got two business verticals that consumers are willing to spend money on so I looked at the stock a little bit closer and I said okay well okay what's the opportunity here and the stock is up 7 and a half% in 2024 which okay that might not be that much but it's not bad for a for a quote unquote retail stock absolutely and you know I just adopted a new dog we've had him about three weeks and I'm like yes pet owners are willing to spend all kinds of money to keep their pets happy right right exactly but there are a lot of pet companies out there there's lots of these kinds of products what sets this company apart you know I think one of the things that sets this company apart is just the fact that it's really focused on its balance sheet it really seems to kind of know where its Niche is and staying in its Lane uh it's got a strong e-commerce business which is good for it and I think that's really what you're looking at you're looking for a company that's that's fundamentally sound has a solid balance sheet and just it has a niche in this market and it's playing in that Niche very well as far as growth potential why would this industry this very consumer discretionary stock have so much growth potential in the next 12 months well I think it's again you're seeing interest rates go down and eventually that's going to trickle into the consumer who has already shown even with higher interest rates they were willing to spend in these categories so you'd have to imagine that that spending is just going to increase as the discretionary dollars become more available and analysts seem to agree with that on Market beat the price target for the stock is $43 and that's an increase of about 40 40 to 45% above where it's at now again a stock like this is kind of speculative but if you're looking for something in a retail space face that's that's a hard upside to ignore oh yeah I had definitely not heard of that company before may have been new to some of our listeners as well so thank you for bringing that one out to our attention and kind of giving us a deep dive into three small cap stocks that have some great potential right now you can find more about all of these stocks right on marketbeat.com and we do a lot of coverage of other stocks just like this that maybe you haven't heard of that could have a really strong upside keep watching our content on marketbeat media and stay with us until next time as always happy investing [Music]

title: Evolv Technologies Stock Up 59%: AI Security & 12-Month Forecast
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] let's move on to your second pick Chris and this one is on your list for not the best reason right so we've talked about evolved Technologies before on the channel and um one of the reasons why it it's on my list right now is unfortunately we did have another school shooting and those are becoming all too common and um this isn't the place to talk about the reason why or reasons to prevent that but one of the things I've noticed about evolved Technologies is the Stock's up about 59.9% in the last 90 days and I can't help but think there's not a that's not a coincidence um this company manufactures touchless um security systems so it's the next generation of metal detectors it allows people to pass through the system very quickly without having to open bags or raise your hand over your head or do any of that stuff and it's Aid driven they use AI as the backbone for their entire system it's turning out to be very effective in detecting guns and detecting small uh knives uh anything that would be potentially used as a weapon and they've got every professional sports league has at least one if not more franchises using it they've got um churches schools hospitals using it the concern that some people might have about the stock is until the last quarter it wasn't profitable but it did turn a profit in its last quarter and that's expected to continue but it's something to watch for the other thing that some investors are concerned about is does this company have a moat in other words there are competitors there other companies that are trying to get into this field um but I think one thing that investors could look at is the annual recurring revenue for evolve continues to grow and that means that they're not losing customers once they get them and that's a very positive so Chris how much growth opportunity could there be for their stock especially considering it just had a near 60% runup yeah that's that's kind of an interesting point here because despite that runup um analysts are still believing that you could still see another about 51% % upside to the stock that would be a price target of about $5.75 and it's still down about 177% for the year despite the runup so there are gains to be made here again it's a speculative stock but it's one that you might want to keep your eye on especially if you're looking at that convergence of small cap and AI [Music]

title: Housing Prices Soar: These 3 Home Stocks May Benefit
text: Kind: captions Language: en housing prices have reached an all-time high in America how could Wall Street be impacted let's dive in really excited about the guest we have joining us today we have Dylan Jovan with behind the markets Dylan you've been on our Channel a couple of times talking about biotech his stock picks earlier this year uh have now doubled in Valu since we last talked Dylan and we're excited not doing biotech this time this time talking about a different industry something everyone's talking about and that's the housing market what got you interested in this Dylan well thank you for having me here it's it's nice to be on uh I'm grateful to be here but you know what actually what got me interested in in the housing market specifically is um I have a lot of people that work with us and they make really good incomes and a lot of friends of mine make really good incomes and they're having trouble affording a house you know this is the foundation of the American dream so I started saying to myself well gosh why do people two income families six figures why are they having so much trouble affording a house what what is this all about so I really started to ask that question and I started to dig in to the root causes about of that and what I found was you know disturbing yeah what did you find I think that's the question that everyone's been asking because housing prices have just kept getting higher the last few years everyone is is talking about how houses are just not affordable anymore did you find that magic answer everyone's been looking for well first I don't think people realize I was surprised to learn just how expensive they had gotten just to give you some context they are right now more expensive houses than they were in 2006 23% more expensive and we use that we know that because you know in the stock market you have a PE ratio or price to earnings ratio which tells you the price of a company based on the earnings of the past 12 months well in the Home Market they have what's called a pi ratio price to income so basically what they do is they look at average homes in relation to average income now historically for the last 50 years since records have been kept in any meaningful modern sense uh the price to income ratio was about 3.4 meaning if you made $100,000 on average the average person made $100,000 the Aver a home would cost 3.4 that or $340,000 in the 2006 bubble that reached a high a then historic record of 4.7 meaning that housing prices were 4.7 times more expensive than the average income well right now we're at 5.8 wow so we are 23% higher than the housing bubble that caused the Great Recession and and the you know the financial crisis of 2008 2009 yeah that is a scary statistic and we all know what happened back then with all the foreclosures and the empty houses that we saw sitting around on the market for quite a while during that season but right now I feel like we're seeing something different in the housing market and that's that demand is still there lots of people are still looking for a home right now despite the very high prices that's right and you know what's what's interesting so if the average person in America so home prices of in the past 10 years since 2014 the average income's gone up 13.8% $73,000 a year so basically home prices could do anything they want in the short term but in the long term they're based on incomes I mean think about it a mortgage company's bank's going to look at your income and say okay we're going to write you a loan based on a third-year income so no matter what they have to approximate incomes in the long term so we have a two prong problem here two-sided issue here one is that housing prices have to come down the other is as you mentioned we still have demand people still want houses so what we've come to find out is that we have a supply problem there just isn't enough houses on the market and Zillow estimates that we are about four and a half million houses short of total demand now because of the inflation that we've had in the past few years a lot of folks aren't going to be buying those big three four 5,000 you know square foot mcmansions anymore they can't afford them we're going to have to there so what kind of homes can they afford so we're actually starting to now look at uh what is what size home should people who make $74,000 you know afford and that's kind of brought us to to where we are today well that all sounds like an opportunity for a company out there and also opportunity for investors who might be looking to to get in on that kind of a market uh what do you have for today well okay so there are a few small companies that manufacture you know they call them manufactured homes they used to call Modular Homes but you know basically one of them is Champion Homes symbol is Sky it's at 9315 now this is one of the largest Builders of manufactured homes I me their home home sold jumped 37% in the past year it's backlog jumped 28% earnings of 91 cents beat estimates by 21% you know ear you know I mean it's just crushing it so you see this new you know demand for these smaller houses that people can afford instead of these 3,000 4,000 5,000 square foot houses you're seeing these companies that are manufacturing 800 1500 2,000 square foot houses go Bonkers Champions right at the top of the list okay so Champion Homes definitely getting these houses affordable houses out quicker and that's something that's been heard a lot on the campaign trail from lots of different people running for office right now it's a topic that across the country everyone cares about so how is that impacting the stock well it's a great point you bring up as a matter of fact both major political candidates have talked about expanding the supply of uh single family homes on the market so that's one of the reasons a great question that Champion Homes has really been just killing it this year just absolutely killing it and as the FED keeps lowering rates they should do very very well as either candidate gets in office is going to be pushing to alleviate this uh housing Supply crisis frankly so Champions at the top of the list are there others stocks or companies like Champion out there that are also getting on that more affordable housing market absolutely another one is cavco Industries symbol AS cvco and this is also one of the largest makers of manufactured homes this includes single family homes they also do RVs vacation cabins they've been doing it for 60 years again this is a story where you have home sales volume up 20% backlog up 21% but that's not yet priced into the stock which is why billionaire investors like Paul tutor Jones Ray Doo and Joel greenblat have been buying the heck out of this stock those are some pretty big names you mentioned that are buying up this stock but how recently have those investors been buying up Capco Industries that's a great question I mean this is the most recent SEC filings we see that Paul tutor Jones Ray Delio Jo Joel greenblat either owned positions and started upgrading theirs or just came in now and started massive buying of these stocks so this is all live and it's all very current within the past few months and the stock has not moved much since they started buying so this is a great entry price for investors that are interested in this kind of uh supply problem with housing and the companies that are going to solve it we talk about upside for a minute just how much upside you think in investors could get if they're getting in now on this company I believe cavco is selling for half you know 50% below what it's worth I also believe the same thing about Sky I actually believe this is a $200 stock I mean it's selling at $93 right now but you know given the right circumstances this stock can really really really take off now do you have one more pick for us that's kind of in the same space of looking to take advantage of the need for more affordable homes well I have a few more picks but those are for our paying customers but I did of course bring another pick for you in the housing area that I actually like a lot uh and that's Toll Brothers this is kind of a name that everybody knows um and what I like about them they don't really specifically Focus they're not known for so focusing on smaller houses but they do make build to order homes which I like a lot because they don't get stuck carrying a thousands 2,000 5,000 homes on their inventory all the time they basically can build build a home to the size and taste of the buyer which gives them immediate flexibility to really go down and customize smaller homes uh for much more affordable prices so in my view that is of the Legacy bigname home builders that we all know uh every day Toll Brothers is probably best fit and Geared for this kind of thing couple of other things to point out about them I mean this is just such a well-run business massive stock BuyBacks I mean they have taken their float from 184 million shares outstanding 10 years ago to just 107 million now okay so what is it trading at right now is this kind of a bargain buy for investors yeah so this is trading at just 12 times free cash flow which is 35 40% lower than it has historically so you have a company that is growing its business that is buying back its stock that is trading historically cheap I mean the company is doing all the right things and as the FED keeps slowing rates that should send this stock soaring too that's a great tip for investors out there now with this stock and the others that we've talked about I want to talk about just the commodity prices does that impact the potential for these we've had such a range in commodity prices over the last few years it is getting better now but can that impact the riskiness maybe of some of these buys well I mean so basically commodity prices by the way they are going down right now they've been going down a lot which tells you that construction isn't great which is by the a recession warning sign you know it tells you that you know this is a this is a problem so we are keeping an eye on this of course but you know commodity prices go down that should make it this is why this is a hedge position that should make it easier for everybody they should be able to sell these units a cheaper prices which in theory would just expand the market get a lot more buyers and fill that four and a half million Supply Gap quicker well you gave us three great picks today that are involved in the the demand for more housing across the country but I know you have a lot more tell us where viewers can go to find more of the stock picks that you have in this industry well you're probably not going to have to go far because we we do a lot of stuff with Market bead but feel free to go to behindthe markets.com that's releasing our special report on housing a research report we spent the last four months doing only at Market beat we're breaking this special story you're getting a quick early preview of what kind of the things we're talking about in that report but that'll be out for our customers first of course for the you know in two weeks and then we will be reling releasing it to the general public so keep your eyes open for it we're very excited about it awesome Dylan always so great to have you on the channel thanks for the great information we're going to link some of Dylan's other videos that he shared before if you liked some of the great tips he gave today he gives a lot of them so we've got those videos linked here too thanks for joining us on marketbeat media and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Star Bulk Carriers Stock 28% Upside: Can This Small Cap Deliver?
text: Kind: captions Language: en there are differing opinions about it but in general the idea is if you that small caps may be one area that investors may want to look at especially if they have a little bit of a speculative taste well that speculative taste usually leads to some pretty good gains at least good gain potential and that's what we see with your first pick let's go into the the first stock that you have on your list of three small cap stocks that are poised for some good growth this year right so the first one I uh I was looking at I was using the market beat stock screener by the way when I was doing this so the stock screen is a great tool to use I did it for this one I was looking in particular for stocks that were going to have at least 10% projected earnings growth over the next 12 months and just to see where it led me my first pick is star bulk carriers now this is a dry bulk shipping company so the Port strike is fresh on every Investor's mind uh you know the importance of these companies in terms of getting uh goods and services into our ports and therefore into the broader economy what I found interesting about starbo is not only are they the biggest US listed carrier in terms of Fleet size they have like 160 vessels but one of their primary markets is China and that got me looking at them a little bit closer and one of the things that they said in their most recent earnings report is that they were noticing a 7.6 increase in shipments into China through July of 2024 the significance of that for me at least was that was before China announced these massive stimulus measures that they just announced so I would expect that you're going to start seeing more Imports into China especially in the areas of iron iron ore because China is one of the leading providers of Steel still regardless of any tariff situation so I would expect that to go up then you have to look at valuation at 6.9 times forward earnings analysts give the stock about a 28% upside and that goes along with a 12.2% dividend yield again the valuation itself may not mean much but when you combine it with positive analyst sentiment and a great dividend yield star buul is one that investors may want to take a close look at that's very interesting as you said this company definitely got hit the last couple of years with the stock going down a little bit when there was less of you know just the interest rate situation and things like that any concern that it's not yet back to those uh historic highs the biggest concern I would have with star buul at this point would be Energy prices we're already starting to see an uptick in oil prices and ironically there were some people that said well you don't have to worry about oil prices going higher because China demand is down well now China demand is up and so that means oil prices are likely to keep going up that would be maybe my one concern here with the stock but otherwise I still think this is a good play right now because I think there's going to be increased demand that'll make up for that any for any upside in oil prices [Music]

I've noticed about evolved Technologies is the Stock's up about 59.9% in the last 90 days and I can't help but think there's not a that's not a coincidence um this company manufactures touchless um security systems so it's the next generation of metal detectors it allows people to pass through the system very quickly without having to open bags or raise your hands over your head or do any of that stuff and it's AI driven they use AI as the backbone for their entire system it's turning out to be very effective in detecting guns and detecting small uh knives uh anything that would be people might have about the stock is until the last quarter it wasn't profitable but it did turn a profit in its last quarter and that's expected to continue but it's something to watch for the other thing that some investors are concerned about is does this company have a moat in other words there are competitors there other companies that are trying to get into this field um but I think one um they interestingly I noticed they don't really it from what I saw on their website they don't really get into the pet food area a lot it's more of the the treats and the toys and other peripheral items that pet owners might have but what I did notice is they've noticed that the pet their pet business is very strong because of the um the willingness of consumers to pay a premium to keep their pets happy and healthy and the Garden business is doing well and so it seems to me that you've got two business verticals that consumers are willing to spend money on so I looked at the stock a little bit closer and I said okay well okay what's the opportunity here and the stock is up 7 and a half% in 2024 which okay that might not be that much but it's not bad for a for a quote unquote retail the fact that it's really focused on its back balance sheet it really seems to kind of know where its Niche is and staying in its Lane uh it's got a strong e-commerce business which is good for it and Niche very well as far as growth potential why would this industry this very consumer discretionary stock have so much growth potential in the next 12 months well I think it's again you're seeing interest rates go down and eventually that's going to trickle into the consumer who has already shown even with higher interest rates they were willing to spend in these categories so you'd have to imagine that that spending is just going to increase as the discretionary dollars become more available and analysts seem to agree with that on Market beat the price target for the stock is $43 and that's an increase of about 40 40 to 45% above where it's at now again a stock like this is kind of speculative but if you're looking for something in a retail space that's that's a hard upside to ignore oh yeah I had definitely not heard of that company before may have been new to some of our listeners as well so thank you for bringing that one out to our attention and kind of giving us a deep this that maybe you haven't heard of that could have a really strong upside keep watching our content on marketbeat media and stay with us until next time as always happy investing [Music]

title: Broadcoms Momentum Returns: Will It Reach New Highs?
text: Kind: captions Language: en broadcom is back on the rise jumping more than 30% in the past three weeks and coming within just $4 of its record high in June is this a sign of renewed success for Tech thanks for joining us here on marketbeat media today I'm bridet Bennett we are diving into what's behind the recent momentum in broadcom stock the company is the leading player in the semiconductor and Technology space providing essential components for things like data centers networking broadband and Wireless Communications their products power everything from your smartphone to high-speed internet connections and are in high demand as the world Becomes Of course more connected and reliant on technology now despite some ups and downs especially over the summer broadcom has maintained steady growth and it's sticking to the stocks two-year uptrend too that is especially impressive when you take a look at competitors like AMD and Micron who are both struggling to gain momentum after the Summer's volatility broadcom did have some lower than expected guidance in their last earnings report the company is still projecting $4 billion in Revenue though for Q4 and that is impressive especially when you consider the challenges in the semiconductor industry they also posted a huge 47% year-over-year Revenue growth in Q3 which caught a lot of attention and helped to fuel this recent rally now the good news for broadcom analysts are still bullish even with that slightly lower guidance they have reiterated buy ratings with price targets ranging anywhere from $25 to as high as $240 which suggests there could be a lot more upside from where stock sits today technically broadcom's chart is looking strong there's a consistent pattern of higher lows which means investors are stepping in to buy on dips and with key indicators still showing bullish signals there's reason to believe the stock could keep climbing with the recent surge in the S&P 500 it is likely broadcom won't be far behind in testing its all-time highs again so if you are looking for exposure to the tech and semiconductor space this could be a company to watch let us know your thoughts are you ready to ride broadcom's momentum or are you waiting to see if this stock might dip again I'd love to hear your feedback comment below join our conversation here on marketbeat media thanks for tuning in to our Channel today don't forget to subscribe to stay tuned for more market news on companies just like this as always happy investing everyone [Music]

title: Toyotas Big Bet on Joby: Will Air Taxis Revolutionize Travel by 2025?
text: Kind: captions Language: en another major investment sends Joby Aviation stock soaring this week how high could it go once the company's air taxis actually go commercial hi I'm Bridget Bennett today we're diving into Toyota's latest investment news for Joby Aviation this is the first mover in the air taxi industry we have featured this company a few times on the channel as their idea continues to gain attention from other major companies now if you've never heard of Joby before here's their plan they want to cut down on commute time with air taxis essentially taking ride share services to the sky so instead of taking that 45 minute Uber to JFK job's New York Air Taxi program plans to get you across town in just 7 minutes and now while this might sound a lot like a helicopter the major difference is the cost helicopters are expens ensive but joby's electric vertical takeoff and Landing aircraft or evals they're designed to make air travel much more affordable they can hold up to four passengers and a pilot and plan to launch service next year that's going to start at roughly $3 per mile with a long-term goal of getting the cost of this kind of travel down to a dollar a mile it's a concept that has major companies like uber and Delta Airlines partner in with and investing in Joby Aviation Toyota Motor Company is joby's largest investor and this week Toyota announced it is doubling the company's investment bringing Toyota's total to a nearly $900 million investment in Joby Aviation this new investment is designed to help with the ramp up and production of joby's eval Fleet Joby has worked with Toyota for components and Manufacturing for years now with a goal of launching their Air Taxi program in 2025 a Jobe has been focusing their efforts on ramping up production to ensure there are enough evels to make their first commercial launch in major cities a success uh the other part of this investment is to help finalize the certification process Joby is nearly finished with the fourth of five stages of us certification of course this is essential for the commercialization of their air t ta program their partnership with Uber has already set Joby up for success with consumer implementation so ordering an air taxi it's going to be just as simple as ordering an Uber on the app but it has to complete certification before that can happen another big bonus for Joby is their work with the US Air Force Joby has now delivered its first Fleet of evals to the Air Force part of a $131 million contract to deliver and operate aircraft for the Department of Defense jobby Aviation has also started the certification process to commercialize in the UAE where the goal is to launch another Air Taxi program in Dubai so that's a lot of exciting news for Joby but there are still plenty of hurdles before commercialization becomes a reality and that's what you can see in the stock price right now after Toyota's investment announcement this week the stock jumped nearly 25% but it's already starting to see a pullback early Thursday trading under $6 the stock hasn't gained a lot of analyst attention but the sentiment from four analysts is strong for Joby Aviation with the highest forecast reaching above $10 and averaging at just under a $9 price Target but with several quarters before commercial operations begin it's likely joby's share price will remain range-bound near 2024 low until the next major news comes out for this company a short interest is also likely to remain high another factor to note for this stock is that the institutions they have been loading up on Joby shares all of 2024 raising their Holdings to roughly 45% of the shares with inflows more than doubling outflows over the past 12 months so many eyes are on the skies waiting for JY aviation's Air Taxi program to officially take off and we will continue to watch it all unfold right here at marketbeat media I'd love to hear your thoughts on whether Joby Aviation will actually make its 2025 commercialization goal and where you think this stock could be headed like comment and subscribe to join the conversation on our channel it's always great to hear from you thanks for joining us today and as always happy investing [Music]

market capitalization they're just also just a huge Healthcare Network almost anybody that has a healthare policy in some way or another United Health Group touches it um they've been growing their dividend by 14.7% uh on an annualized rate in the last three years one of the Tailwinds for this company is they just recently acquired LHC group and the significance of that is that it's moving United Health Group more into the Home healthc Care Arena and this is an area where um there's been a lot of Buzz about this because we're seeing obviously the the baby boomer generation is now well into the retirement years they're getting to that point where you might be looking at you need Extended Care you need a little bit more of assisted living areas and that's something that we don't have the infrastructure in as a as a country yet but we're building it and companies like LHC group were on the Forefront of that now UA now United Health Group is getting in on that as well so I think that's going to be a big Tailwind for their business this is again a stock that um it's it's not necessarily A flashy stock but it's one that it just it hits in an area where all Americans need to be in and it's a it's just a solid stock for investors yeah absolutely as you said it's one of those largest healthcare companies in the country everyone's heard of it um do you think there's any other title: Rocket Labs 100% Rally: Should You Buy or Stay Cautious?
text: Kind: captions Language: en up more than 100% year-over-year rocket Labs reach for the stars and Beyond is paying off in a big way for investors at least for now anyway hello and thanks for joining us here at marketbeat media I'm Bridget Bennett today we are taking a deep dive into the big momentum and what's really been a stellar year for this Aerospace Exploration company the stock soared after another successful launch of the electron rocket now this is the company's Flagship product designed for small satellite launches it's something that is in big Demand right now this was rocket lab's 53rd electron rocket but the company believes in the next 6 years there will be demand for another 10,000 satellite launches but that's really just the beginning of Rocket lab's growing list of offerings and potential revenue streams along with launch services this company is also offering spacecraft satellites and on orbit Management Solutions all with the goal of making it faster easier and of course cheaper to get to space it's a concept that has demand for their services continuing to grow which is much needed for the company's long-term sustainability rocket Labs is still very much in that growth phase which means it's not yet profitable and is still struggling with cash flow but this company has been around the Aerospace Market since 2006 and that is long enough to not have any issues borrowing Capital so the company is earning Revenue serving commercial contract and government customers about 70% of the company's revenue is from its launch business and space Services business putting rocket Labs a step ahead of many aerospace companies that are no longer standing while rocket lab bulls May point to the company's continued successful launches and the growing demand as the reason for the now near $9 stock price the Bears are warning about the increase in short interest a short interest in rocket lab stock is 18.7% of the float that's up more than 2% in just 30 days that means investors should not discount the idea that some of that recent and rally well that might be due to short covering analysts have the price target for the stock at $668 that's about 28% below its current stock price so what does all of that mean for investors well as one of the leading Aerospace stocks many are choosing to hold on to Rocket Labs as a long-term investment if so now you could continue holding and wait for the next dip as a strong Strate strategy for the stock if you're looking at some short-term trades though rocket lab options chain show the heaviest call activity around $10 and the heaviest put activity around 950 over the next 30 days so this rally could still have a 10 to 15% upside that 30-day Mark is also the company's next earnings reports on November 7th which could shed some more light on Rocket lab's path to profitability so where do you stand are you with the bulls hoping to see this stock and this industry take off or are you one of the Bears who are maybe more skeptical about rocket lab's long-term profitability I would love to hear your thoughts in the comments and have you join the conversation about where rocket Labs might be heading thanks for joining us here at marketbeat media go ahead and like comment and subscribe to our channel for more market news stay on our channel for a deep dive into more companies just like this one as always happy investing everyone [Music]

title: Home Depot: Reliable Dividends for Income Investors
text: Kind: captions Language: en well speaking of commodity prices we'll move on to your second stock pick and that is Home Depot this company has seen commodity prices changing a lot over the last few years they have and yet over that time the company has increased their dividend by an average of 11.69% over the last three years so again company that's easily outpacing inflation if you been buying and holding the stock the rate at which your dividend is increasing is beating inflation that's what you want to see as an income oriented investor now uh the story with Home Depot it's 26 times forward earnings I put that in my article that's a little bit expensive right now however I think what investors should be aware of is that you've been seeing a lot of movement in this stock in the last three months investors were kind of frontloading this stock in anticipation of rate cuts which is supposed to be very beneficial to the housing sector so I'm not so I think you have to take the valuation with a little grain of salt here and say okay they've bit up the stock high now let's see where it goes from here and unfortunately because of the news we've just gotten this last weekend with hurricane Helen and the major damage that has gone on in the southeast United States that's going to be a Tailwind for companies like Home Depot and Lowe's uh because their products are going to be in demand I mean this is kind of one of those where you kind of have to take what the Market's giving you and it's a sad thing but it's also something that investor can take advantage of especially with a dividend payer Like Home Depot yeah that's an interesting point that hurricane storm season has an impact on these companies um but let's talk about the impact of interest rates that's been all everyone's talking about in inflation and interest rates and now that we've seen those come down does that really matter to the bottom line of these companies are people really holding off on any projects until those interest rates come down you know that's an interesting point Bridget and I'm not sure if I would say like a company Like Home Depot or a company like Lowe's I kind of would say they're kind of housing adjacent they don't necessarily rely on interest rates but it certainly is helpful for them when you look at interest rates you might look at the home builders you might look at even companies like Zillow that are right there in the actual buying and selling of houses and supply and demand and all that companies like Home Depot and Lowe's they can benefit even when people are staying in their houses because of remodeling projects and different things like that but as we've seen over the last couple of years some of that work has dried up because people did it in 2020 and 2021 and now they don't need to do that anymore and they're going to stay in their house so I think in this particular situation yes lower interest rates which drive more housing activity can be beneficial to Home Depot in this moment right now [Music]

fact that cocoa price have been eating into the company's earnings a little bit now in the article I did bring up that there are some concerns that gop1 drugs are going to eat into Hershey's revenue title: AST SpaceMobile Takes Major Leap in Global Connectivity with Satellite Launch
text: Kind: captions Language: en first it was the telegraph then the telephone the cell phone and now the next stage of telecommunications is one step closer to [Music] reality here with an update on as space mobile is Market beat analyst jayu Jay it's been a really busy September for this company yes uh after seven years and a billion dollars later they finally launched their first five Bluebird satellites into low earth orbit um this is their black one bluebirds and they're finally finally up in space so anyone who had doubts that they would be able to get up in space well those doubts are proven wrong yeah we did a video on this one just a month or so ago kind of going through what this company is and really their idea is to make sure that the whole world is connected right talk a little bit more for those who missed that last video sure so as space mobile is trying to make the uh make drop calls a thing of the past normally you have to be within a cell tower range in order for your cell phone service to to to stay steady uh and to not have drop calls uh what a space mobile is doing is they are creating a space-based Broadband cellular network that is going to be there to basically fill in all the gaps in between cell towers in fact it's like they're putting up 168 cell towers in space and theoretically you should be able to complete calls anywhere on the planet and unlike satellite phones you're not going to need any special equipment basically any off-the-shelf smartphone will enable you to place a call anywhere in the world I think the other interesting thing that you wrote in your article about this is that right now you know as Americans you might think most of the world is covered with cell phone coverage but really this company is opening up an opportunity to reach more customers right absolutely uh basically according to a they believe that there's 67 billion out there waiting for them by 2032 uh the reality is 42% of the global population uh doesn't have access to cellular service uh they want to cash in on some of that and they are teaming up with uh over 40 uh Telecom mobile network providers to go ahead and basically have them provide this Fillin service who knows they may even actually provide you know full service AT&T and Verizon the two biggest uh cell phone players in the US they've come on board they've come on board head first uh you know AT&T has a six-year deal with them Verizon is basically spending a B100 million uh in order to get their uh customers outfitted with this service so the other thing to keep in mind is that now they are past the concept stage they actually have the satellites the first satellites in space so a lot of these other memorandum of understanding uh for potential contracts Partners they can move forward because now it's no longer a concept but they're actually getting closer to commercialization and so I expect to see a lot of Theseus actually turn into Partnerships uh in real conscious tracks yeah I think those Partnerships are a huge part about this company's cash flow let's talk about that a little bit because they've spent a lot investing to get this infrastructure up but now with these contracts uh where do they stand with cash flow they have about $440 million in cash now each satellite costs about $30 million uh the first block one five satellites cost $150 million to basically manufacture and put up in the space block two satellites they probably cost less but we're looking at 17 block two satellites which are actually 10 times more powerful than the block one satellites and those are looking to go up uh in 2025 with the first batch going up in first quarter 2025 now the company made a major move right after launching its first five satellites they announced a second stock option uh talk about what that's done right so actually about five or six days before the September 12th launch uh as had put out an announcement basically stating that they were going to be doing a $400 million secondary offering this is what's known as an at the market offering which means that they can sell shares at the market up to $400 million now that threw off a lot of investors uh and the stock did Take a Tumble because they basically stated that they we're not looking to raise any more cash through offerings uh in 2024 now the at the money offering uh actually has a three-year time limit so they have up to three years to be able to raise the $400 million in cash by selling stock um so they could start doing that 2025 but the notice basically says they can do it at any time living yeah let's talk about all of the movement this stock has seen this month you'd expect with the major launch that they be a lot of positive reaction in the stock to that news but that paired with the new offering there's been a lot of volatility for ests this month so the offering basically took the air kind of out of the stock uh it fell down to the 25 area and when they did launch on September 12th the stock actually pulled back some and then the day after is when the stock rallied back up into the 30s but it has been slow pulling back now and that's mostly because you know they don't produce revenues yet and you almost have a sell the news reaction that tends to happen when a significant event actually happens so now uh we have to look forward to uh potential catalysts down the road well with all the movement we've seen in the stock this month is this a buy for investors right now or is it still a pretty big risk oh yeah this is a definite speculative stock like I said they don't generate any revenues yet but they're getting closer now to that commercialization stage and according to a there's a potentially 67 billion doll out there by up to 2032 by filling in these connectivity gaps with the telephone carriers well we will continue to watch all of the moves and where this stock goes right here at Market Beach thanks for the Deep dive into the latest news for this company and thank you for joining us here on Market beat stay tuned And subscribe cribe for more market news as always happy investing [Music]

title: Why Congress Is Betting Big on Broadcom in 2024
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] I'll Thomas let's move on to that second hot stock members of Congress are buying right now yeah that's broadcom it's another chip stock uh in 20124 its uh growth is accelerating in high double digits I think last quarter it was close to 50% growth that's supposed it or is expected to continue to be strong um it's being driven by Rebound in this n Market markets but also there's an upcoming um Apple upgrade cycle Apple's getting ready to release their latest phones that's supposed to drive a multi-year upgrade cycle in that business Apple's a huge customer of broadcom and then again members of Congress are buying it we've got four members on both sides of the aisle including Nancy Pelosi um we have representatives and um Senators uh four members made five purchases now broadcom also has something else in common with Nvidia and that's a recent stock split uh what does that mean Chris well as we've talked about on this channel numerous times the stock split doesn't really do anything to change the fundamental valuation of a stock but it's interesting that you're seeing Congressional buying of both Invidia and broadcom after the split because that does suggest that there's going to be momentum in both of those stocks going forward both of these stocks are in the chip or the AI industry are there more regulations happening at that Federal level that Congress might just know more information about than the rest of us yeah there's there's no major legislation pending but you know that they're talking about it so they they certainly know which way the wind is blowing yep [Music]

title: What the Bulls and Bears Are Saying About NVIDIA Stock
text: Kind: captions Language: en the Bulls or the Bears who will prevail when it comes to Nvidia let's dive [Music] in here to talk about these two different viewpoints on the biggest stock in the market right now is Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris Nvidia has been the hot topic for years now uh recently there's been a lot of movement on this stock let's talk about what we're seeing right now so right now uh Nvidia jumped about 4% yesterday had been Tuesday the 24th and that actually led the S&P 500 higher uh at at start of the day kind of weak and then because of Nvidia Nvidia kind of led the way and the reason why it jumped 4% yesterday was because um Jensen Wong the CEO announced that he was done with this round of selling that had taken place that he had been doing since the company's earnings report in late August I put this in my article as one of the as kind of a bull bear Counterpoint this is kind of one of the weakest reasons I think that people have to sell the stock but I understand the I understand the thinking um retail investors sometimes get nervous when they see a CEO or another corporate Insider selling a lot of stock but in general these are nothing Burgers um most of these events are orchestrated well well in advance they're called these rule 1065 B1 trading plans and they have to file these with the SEC usually months in advance of when they actually sell so the SEC is well informed about the fact that these sales are going to take place it's just a matter of when they take place and the CEO or The Insider doesn't really know what the stock price is going to be on that date so a lot of people thinking that Jensen Wong was selling cuz he knew something bad was going to happen to Nvidia that's really not the case here nevertheless on the news that he wasn't selling any more stock the stock did start to go up so it looks like the Bears and the Bulls had a little bit of win on that one on that point yeah um moving on to another point that you brought up in your article uh the Bears are arguing this Blackwell delay um as a reason to not go for this stock give us both sides of the argument on Blackwell well this is another one that I would say among the arguments that I would have this one's kind of a not very strong the the reasoning that some investors have is that you have companies like meta and Microsoft who have already expressed an interest in getting their hands on other high performance AI chips they don't want to be just beholden to Nvidia that's all well and good and certainly there are some competitors along the way Advanced Micro devices being the most prominent one but none of these competitors at this particular moment are ready to capture market share at scale and keep in mind Nvidia has 85% of the market and so I mean it's it's going to be really really hard for these other companies to to start chipping away that market share unless they have ai chips that they can start delivering at scale before Blackwell comes out and Blackwell is going to be available by the end of this year or early next year according to Nvidia which is not that far off at this point exactly exactly another Point argument that you pointed out in your article is talking about kind of what's going on in the economy we know we just saw these rate Cuts it's all anyone is talking about right now what's the argument from the Bears and the Bulls on how those rate Cuts might impact Nvidia stock right this actually to me is the strongest of the arguments if you were going to make a bearish case there's a lot of contradictory signals in the market right now and you've seen this with chip stocks over the last couple of months they go up they go down if they if there's fears of a recession they go down if there if there's thinking that there's going to be a soft Landing they go up the concern is that if the economy goes into a recession that the companies that need nvidia's chips are going to slow down on AI spending in my article I cited a study from payments that said said companies that spent between 1 million and 5 million said that there's really not going to be any change in their spending now all of that can change but this would be the one concern that I would have if I was an Nvidia shareholder would be would companies be starting to pull back on that AI spend if the economy goes into a broader recession it's too early to tell and to be honest we just don't really know right now another argument you pointed out for or against Nvidia is the value ation of this company let's talk about what the Bears and bulls have to say about that so this is one that you hear about almost every day um and that's just that Nvidia is a very expensive stock and by expensive for the retail investors that may not quite understand what I'm saying here um I'm not necessarily talking about the stock price they've split their stock it's not expensive necessarily from that measure the stock price but it's expensive from valuations like price to earnings uh um the multiple was I think around 23 times forward PE when I wrote the article um there's other back ofth metric back in the envelope metrics that investors use price to sales Peg and by almost any measure Nvidia is an expensive stock to buy you're paying a premium to buy the company's future earnings which many investors feel already priced into the stock the more compelling argument I guess I would say there is people look at in market cap which is two which was 2.84 trillion when I wrote the article and that's an amount that's equal to what the entire cloud computing and generative AI Market will be worth around 2030 so it's expressing the fact that again this is an expensive stock investors are paying a premium for it my Counterpoint to that is that you're it's really kind of feudal to argue against math and that's really what you're doing if you're taking the other side of this I don't like to argue against math but I would also point out that Nvidia has margins of over 75% and that's using generally accepted accounting principles its profit margin was 55% I mean that means that they're just generating a lot of profit on what they do and that doesn't show any signs of slowing down earnings are what Drive stock price growth and so you have a reason to believe that even though the Stock's expensive it's going to continue to go up because earnings are going to continue to go up and unless that changes it doesn't really matter what the math says it just seems like the Stock's going to go up so I'm sounding like you are with the bulls on this one is that right I really am with with again with the one caveat being the broader economy but there's so many question marks around that right now I think investors can safely dollar cost average into Nvidia which means just putting a regular amount aside and putting it into Nvidia at a reg at different intervals you don't have to worry necessarily about what the prices of the stock on any given day if it does drop a little bit woohoo you're getting stock on sale and if it goes up a little bit okay then you've bought the stock at where it is now and that might be the new floor so you're okay but you know to S to Simply sit there and say you should ignore Nvidia I just don't think the other arguments really hold that much weight for me well thank you for the rundown Chris going over the Bulls versus the Bears in Nvidia you can find the full article that Chris wrote linked with this video and in our description thanks for joining us here on marketbeat media be sure to subscribe and stay tuned for more market news as always happy investing [Music]

the news that he wasn't selling any more stock the stock did start to go up so it looks like the Bears and the Bulls had a little bit of win on that one on that point yeah um moving on to another point that you brought up in your article uh the Bears are arguing this Blackwell delay um as a reason to not go for this stock give us both sides of the argument on Blackwell well this is another one that I would say among the arguments that I would have this one's kind of a not very strong the the reasoning that some investors have is that you have companies like meta and Microsoft who have already expressed an interest in getting their hands on other high performance AI chips they don't want to be just beholden to Nvidia that's all well and good and certainly there are some competitors along the way Advanced Micro devices being the most prominent one but none of these competitors at this particular moment are ready to capture market share at scale and keep in mind Nvidia has 85% of the market and so I mean it's it's going to be really really hard for these other companies to to start chipping away that market share unless they have ai chips that they can start delivering at scale before Blackwell comes out and Blackwell is going to be available by the end of this year or early next year according to Nvidia which is not that far off at this point exactly exactly another Point argument that you pointed out in your article is talking about kind of what's going on in the economy we know we just saw these rate Cuts it's all anyone is talking about right now what's the argument from the Bears and the Bulls on how those rate Cuts might impact Nvidia stock right this actually to me is the strongest of the arguments if you were going to make a bearish case there's a lot of contradictory signals in the market right now and you've seen this with chip stocks over the last couple of months they go up they go down if they if there's fears of a recession they go down if there if there's thinking that there's going to be a soft Landing they go up the concern is that if the economy goes into a recession that the companies that need nvidia's chips are going to slow down on AI spending in my article I cited a study from payments that said said companies that spent between 1 million and 5 million said that there's really not going to be any change in their spending now all of that can change but this would be the one concern that I would have if I was an Nvidia shareholder would be would companies be starting to pull back on that AI spend if the economy goes into a broader recession it's too early to tell and to be honest we just don't really know right now another argument you pointed out for or against Nvidia is the value ation of this company let's talk about what the Bears and bulls have to say about that so this is one that you hear about almost every day um and that's just that Nvidia is a very expensive stock and by expensive for the retail investors that may not quite understand what I'm saying here um I'm not necessarily talking about the stock price they've split their stock it's not expensive necessarily from that measure the stock price but it's expensive from valuations like price to earnings uh um the multiple was I think around 23 times forward PE when I wrote the article um there's other back ofth metric back in the envelope metrics that investors use price to sales Peg and by almost any measure Nvidia is an expensive stock to buy you're paying a premium to buy the company's future earnings which many investors feel already priced into the stock the more compelling argument I guess I would say there is people look at in market cap which is two which was 2.84 trillion when I wrote the article and that's an amount that's equal to what the entire cloud computing and generative AI Market will be worth around 2030 so it's expressing the fact that again this is an expensive stock investors are paying a premium for it my Counterpoint to that is that you're it's really kind of feudal to argue against math and that's really what you're doing if you're taking the other side of this I don't like to argue against math but I would also point out that Nvidia has margins of over 75% and that's using generally accepted accounting principles its profit margin was 55% I mean that means that they're just generating a lot of profit on what they do and that doesn't show any signs of slowing down earnings are what Drive stock price growth and so you have a reason to believe that even though the Stock's expensive it's going to continue to go up because earnings are going to continue to go up and unless that changes it doesn't really matter what the math says it just seems like the Stock's going to go up so I'm sounding like you are with the bulls on this one is that right I really am with with again with the one caveat being the broader economy but there's so many question marks around that right now I think investors can safely dollar cost average into Nvidia which means just putting a regular amount aside and putting it into Nvidia at a reg at different intervals you don't have to worry necessarily about what the prices of the stock on any given day if it does drop a little bit woohoo you're getting stock on sale and if it goes up a little bit okay then you've bought the stock at where it is now and that might be the new floor so you're okay but you know to S to Simply sit there and say you should ignore Nvidia I just don't think the other arguments really hold that much weight for me well thank you for the rundown Chris going over the Bulls versus the Bears in Nvidia you can find the full article that Chris wrote linked with this video and in our description thanks for joining us here on marketbeat media be sure to subscribe and stay tuned for more market news as always happy investing [Music]

title: Nvidia Tops Congressional Buy List
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] let's get to some of the three hot stocks that Congress members are buying right now Thomas your first one uh really no surprise really it's not a surprise it is the hottest stock in the market today Nvidia but in regards to Congress five members have made Seven purchases in the last 90 days uh that includes Nancy Pelosi we have members of both sides of the aisle so it's by partisan buying in addition to the Congressional buying there's also a tremendous amount of Market support so this is more than just a congressional play Nvidia is the most followed stock a most upgraded stock it's got a top rated stock on marketbeat websit so there are many factors going into the Nvidia trade yeah I think one of the things that's uh interesting to me about Nvidia being one of the most uh traded Stocks by Congress especially it's being heavily bought is the idea that you're starting to see the US Congress now actively look at AI they understand that this is not something that's a bubble it's not something that's going away and now they're looking to find out how Congress should or might be able to regulate it that's why I think it's really interesting that now you're starting to that's coinciding with activity in Nvidia all right and speaking to our our conspiracy theory before coincidentally Nvidia is now up to potentially sell its ships to Saudi AR Arabia and who would have that knowledge first but the members of Congress correct that's a very interesting point anything about Nvidia being down the volatility this stock has seen in the last month or so are members of Congress still all in on this stock despite the recent volatility yeah I haven't seen any selling and there have been some recent purchases so like the most recent purchases were made after the stock dipped I think that the members of Congress are and generally speaking are buying Nvidia in alignment with the up trend [Music]

title: Fed Walking a Tightrope with Rate Cuts
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] you've been predicting volatility for weeks too and I think that's exactly what we're seeing with this rate cut it didn't just magically solve some of the economic concerns and issues that people have how long do you think the market could be in this volatility stage I mean it could last for months you have to remember that the situation we're in is the result of not just the last two or three years of stimulus spending and inflation but also the preceding 10 years of easy money policy and the Japanese Yen carry trade the carry trade is really significant because that's been building up for years people borrowing money from Japan to lend to the United States and that money has to come back and be paid back to Japan which means that there's going to be a lot of selling so I would expect any Market uptick to be followed by a downtick as people sell into the rallies but again so far as the soft Landing scenario them play any down kick down tick should also result in a buying opportunity for stocks that are presenting values yeah let's talk about that a little bit more what does all of this volatility mean as far as potential opportunities for Traders well right now with recession not on the table I mean it's on the table but it's just a risk it's something we're worried about it's not up in our face I would expect the market to move sideways with that same Dynamic I just just described you know selling into the rally to take profits and close out the carry trade also moving to flight safety but any downt should result in a buying opportunity as people focus on their values now the big risk is that uh the uh the labor data or other data will start to point more significantly towards a recession and in that scenario we might start seeing more um intensified selling uh more flight to safety selling more riskof selling and that could lead to a more significant Market downturn yeah and your article that you wrote which I'll link to here you also talked about this rate cut is going to take months potentially to even be reflected in the data uh talk about that a little more well right it's generally accepted that it takes 12 to 18 months for a single 25 basis point cut to fully impact the market so we're looking at a quarter or two before we start seeing significant changes in the data which gives us six months of upcoming pce CPI and labor data that is going to drive volatility as I said before in good news is going to cause the market to go higher but any bad news will cause it to move lower and one last thing I want to close out with today this is the First Rate cut we have seen in years but some people are predicting potentially even more yet to come do you think we're going to continue to see this aggressive approach well the the FED has indicated that they've indicated that they want to cut another 50 basis points by the end of the year and another 100 points next year uh and if they do that it just plays right into what I've been saying they're either going to usher in that economic shift sooner than we expected or they're trying to front run a recession and again we're just waiting for the next few months of data to understand are they actually going to cut more or do they need to keep rates where they are now or possibly even raise them back up again if inflation starts to rise again because you have to remember there's still a lot of demand in the economy consumers are still spending even though the housing market is pretty crappy um people want to buy houses so if the price of houses starts to fall inflation or interest rates start to fall it's going to Spur demand in that sector we can already see oil prices starting to move back up again all of those things play into inflation um I think that ultimately we're still walking that tight rope the FED still has plenty of risks we're still data dependent and the next few months are going to be very telling well we will continue to watch how well they balance on that tight RPP they're walking right here on Market beach in the days and weeks and months to come thanks for joining us for this market analysis Thomas and thank you for watching marketbeat media subscribe and like our Channel comment and join the conversation to stay tuned for more market news right here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music] oh

title: Is Palantir Heading for a $50 Price Target?
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] you've been encouraging people to get in on paler since the early stages um and we talked a little bit about some analysts thinking the stock price was already too high well it just has kept going up now uh what do you think it means for investors to try to get in right now at this price point well I guess my advice might be that if you don't currently own paler shares and and perhaps maybe even if you do you might want to wait for the stock to pull back a little bit and I'll show you what I mean when we look at the paler chart over the last year um you've seen that the stock has gone up significantly um two or three times and in each case at least in the last two cases it's also dropped down a little bit too so there's been sort of an initial Euphoria and then the stock Retreats back however what's important important to note is that the surge it made in March and April of this year the dip wasn't quite as severe as the one perhaps early in 2024 so what that's saying is the Stock's making higher highs and it's making lower lows and that's something that's very that's a bullish trend for the stock right now that's playing out in the analyst estimate the overall consensus estimate for peners that they are looking for a stock to be trading around the $29 doar level which is kind of around in here however palent here just got a very bullish price Target from Bank of America this week of $50 per share why is that significant well if you look at the trough right here in paler to the current price here that's a difference of about 40 42% well if you took that and said there's going to be another 40 to 42% um gain in the stock from where it is right now it puts it at guess what about $50 so that's where some analysts believe the stock could go in the next 12 months the key is when do you get in because the reality when you look at this chart is if you weren't in Palante here when it started making the big gains you've missed out on those big gains however if you look at where Bank of America believes the stock can go you can still get the stock today and it be potentially looking at a nice 40% gain yes it's always that risk or that gamble of where is it going to go from here and that makes all the difference um I do want to talk about Chris this is for individual investors who are looking to buy paler on their own but now that paler is into the S&P 500 it means a lot of people a lot of those bigger hedge funds they're going to be purchasing this stock what does that mean for paler and for investors well you know what it's going to mean actually I think for a lot of uh investors is you're going to see perhaps maybe some short-term volatility in paler but I think in the long term you're going to see some of that Vol that volatility smooth out because once a stock gets more heavily owned by institutions there's a little bit more price stability there um so I think I don't want to sit here and throw cold water and say the biggest gains are all gone as I just showed you on the chart and we the analysts are projecting the price to be there can be still some significant runup with paler stock but I think that right now in the in the short term investors might expect a little bit of choppiness because remember for every buyer there has to be a seller so there's going to be a little bit of choppiness as institutions try to buy and there has to be some people trying to sell well this is all some good information for anyone interested in paler or some good news for those who may already own the thanks again Chris for going over what's been happening with paler this week we will continue to follow this stock story right here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

and weeks and months to come thanks for joining us for this market analysis Thomas and thank you for watching marketbeat media subscribe and like our Channel comment and join the conversation to stay tuned for more market news right here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

title: Has SMCI Already Hit Bottom?
text: Kind: captions Language: en a delayed annual report has had super microcomputers stock in a lot of volatility this month but has it reached its bottom yet here to dive into where this stock is at right now our Market beat analysts Chris marot and Thomas Hughes Thomas you had an article this week about where smci stock stands right now and whether or not we're close to that bottom what do you think we are at right now Thomas well I think that there are still some risks but I think that the stock is at or very near its bottom if you look at the chart uh the selloff since the peak earlier this year it shaved 65% off of the stock price but it's retraced almost 100% of the rally that occurred this year which to me is a bubble it was an aid driven bubble the market got ahead of itself started to sell off as some expectations were reset that sell off was accelerated by a short report over the summer but now we're back at these levels where the stock was very attractive last year it's in a hot Market it's still growing so it should still be an attractive stock today and Chris I think we're seeing a little bit of that in the market right now what has the stock done most recently in the last few days well what we've been seeing since about um a little bit after Labor Day let's just say is the stock is starting to go up a little bit like Thomas said I think there's some buyers that are starting to look at this and saying it's overdone I think Thomas made a really good point in saying there was probably going to be a selloff in the stock when you saw how high it had gone in such a short time 65% drop is not just because of a short selling report I mean that especially when we don't really know what the details of that report are well right and the selloff Really began before the short report came out the short report really just accelerated pushed it down to the bottom it was a resetting of expectations and then their earnings over the summer margin was a little bit weaker than expected and that gave the market some reasons to fear so it is kind of a combination of factors but again the stock has retraced back to these levels where it was attractive before the market created a bubble so we have to ask ourselves has anything really fundamentally changed for the business because if it has it could go lower but if it's still in a strong industry it's at a good price it should begin to rebound and next year should be a solid year for the market I think that question is what has a lot of investors having some caution right now there is some uncertainty and some people questioning that report that both of you just mentioned uh Thomas let's dive into what's the issue with this delayed report and what are some people speculating well right so the report was delayed it's the end of the year filing um and it was delayed we don't really know why but I assume given uh the benefit of the doubt that it is just an overabundance of caution uh the Hindenberg short report certainly raised some doubts about the company's financial reporting um there has been some history in the past of some misrepresented numbers but that was years ago we have to assume the company has moved on from that and that uh once the new the finalized report comes out a lot of those um fears will be alleviated Chris do you have any concerns about the report delay I I don't um what I would be more interested in going forward is going to be hearing about one concern that was brought up in the Hindenberg report that was outside of the financials is potentially that uh super micro is understating the competitive pressures that there are some super micro customers that are looking aggressively looking for lower cost Alternatives that they feel might have better quality if I'm an investor looking to buy the stock that's something that might concern me a little bit more than accounting rate irregularities which I agree with Thomas I think this delay is probably being done out of an abundance of caution to make sure that they've got the numbers right and I don't necessarily think that's going to be the reason why you should stay out of the stock right now and Thomas you already alluded to this that there's just as much of a risk the stock could go down as it could go up um it just depends on the solidness of the industry but Chris you just brought up an interesting point the competition is that part of what we're seeing with with the stock price is that there's just more competitors and more saturation of the AI market and what super micro is providing I don't know if that's the reason yet but I I would say that could be an issue going forward I mean when super micro reported earnings they also said that they're not seeing any slowdown in demand from Nvidia which is one of their biggest customers in terms of the data center market so that would seem to be good however that's also the type of thing that the Hindenburg report is is trying to question the answer that I have for You Bridget is I just don't know and that would make me a little bit hesitant to get in right at this moment on super micro but it doesn't necessarily mean it's not a good stock to own over time it's just maybe I don't want to jump in right now right right what Chris is saying plays into the idea that there may be volatility over the next few weeks or months um like the proof and the pudding will probably come out with the next earnings report when they deliver or don't deliver on what the expectations are right now the market is expecting about 200% Revenue growth in the next quarter which is substantial it's huge however it does align with nvidia's own ramp in Revenue over the last couple years and you had to think there's some correlation between the two and also the analysts have been lowering their targets so it's a low bar the company could very easily outperform and even if it just reports in alignment with the consensus The Whisper numbers are low consensus so that would still be a strong report all that said I think that the Q2 report could be a catalyst for higher share prices let's move on to short interest a little bit you talk about that in your article too Thomas uh what's the concern there right so the short interest is a big factor in the stock price right now I mean the the short report from Hindenberg was matched by another short report by another short selling firm uh short interest is up at 15% they certainly took advantage of the report to help Drive the stock back to these lower lows but again at 15% there's ample fuel for short covering rally and a short squeeze so all we need is some good news to come out and the stock could not only just move higher but rocket higher all right so again pulling it back to the near-term in volatility High short interest fighting against a bullish Outlook is going to provide volatility so I would certainly expect to see the market make some whipsaw moves uh throughout September and possibly into October and maybe through the end of the year I'm hearing a lot of volatility expect a lot of changes quickly especially in the short term um let's talk about what this stock could look like for investors long term well long term you have to assume that the peak set earlier this year is the market pricing in the best case scenario so if we get a best case scenario in the results we can see the stock climb back up to retest those highs um otherwise I see the stock advancing possibly even um where are we at possibly even doubling or more in price over the next 12 months to 24 months but setting a new high uh could be difficult without some other Catalyst for the Outlook that's some great information for our viewers to consider when they are looking at buying smci thank you both for diving into this company and this stock a little bit more today we'll continue to follow this stock and many others right here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]
