title: MarketBeat Minute: Markets Struggle After Retail Sales, Volatility Ahead
text: Kind: captions Language: en here with your Market beat benett I'm bridet Bennett Equity markets tried to advance on Tuesday after better than expected retail sales data but could not hold the gains the 2% monthly retail sales figure is better than expected but the year-over-year gains don't offset inflation and the core figure X Autos was tepid now the takeaway is that retail sales growth is sluggish at best and on the brink of Contracting after years of tight fed policy the price action in the S&P 500 could spell trouble for Traders and investors on Wednesday the move shows resistance at the existing all-time high and raises the odds that the fomc policy decision will be a sell the news event no matter what the takeaway is that the market volatility is expected to remain elevated and could lead to whipsaw price action if not a significant decline in equity prices Friday could be a challenging trading day as it is triple witching for Equity index options and Futures that's your Market beat minute for Tuesday September 17th happy investing everyone [Music]

title: FOMC's Rate Cut Decision Could Drive Market Swings
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] do you expect that volatility to continue even after we get Wednesday's report a potential interest rate cut uh it may actually increase after the rate cut because the rate cut should come with a policy statement that either affirms or refutes the Market's Outlook the way I see it right now the economic data is still solid enough that the FED shouldn't Cut Rate too quickly because by cutting them too quickly they could actually reacceleration inflation they don't want to do that uh so again uh High expectation for a cut this Wednesday also a high expectation for the policy statement and what it may point to later on in the year so the soft Landing that they are looking for what would that actually look like Thomas well what that looks like is inflation slowly trending down to the 2% Target rate the fomc able to slowly cut interest rates to the point where in stabilizes at or near that 2% rate because the economic data is still so good I mean to me it's very healthy relative to pre pandemic periods that should lead to a broadening economic rally because with weakened or diminished economic headwinds a wider range of businesses those more susceptible to interest rates will be able to have better business uh consumers should start spending more and so we should really see a really much broader stock market rally possibly beginning early to mid next year that all sounds like the ideal soft Landing but I think there's a lot of questions on will it actually go down that way is that why we're seeing so much volatility right now right that is the volatility I mean that's the the the nut that's the in a nutshell right there because we're on this tight rope path towards 2% inflation we have U the soft Landing in play but there are risks the fomc maybe they held rates high for too long that could cause a recession if recession's in the cards we won't even know it until the next round of monthly data comes out but at the same time if the FED hasn't done their job enough inflation will only re accelerate and that will keep us in a higher for longer state so again you know the market is just wrestling with this Whata if scenario of what's really happening while the soft Landing is is is taking place so expect a lot of ups and downs along the way while we try and figure out where we're at right if we haven't said it enough in this video volatility is the name of the game for at least the next month all right well thank you very much for the analysis Thomas and for going through where we're at right now it's going to be a big week ahead and we will follow it all right here at Market beat thanks for following us make sure to like And subscribe to our channel for more market news and as always happy investing [Music] oh

title: Rate Cuts May Fuel Continued Market Volatility
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's the week the Market's been waiting for for two years but rate Cuts could finally be here here to talk about what this means for the market volatility is Market bead analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas you've been following all of the economic factors very closely for the last few years and this week this month especially we've seen a lot of volatility what's behind that well the volatility started back in July with the CPI report uh it was kind of exacerbated over the last few weeks with the pce and the CPI report again but what it means is the market is getting ready for a shift in economic fundamentals as you said we've been waiting for years for the fomc to lower interest rates when they lower rates it will ease economic headwinds it's supposed to help uh not accelerate growth but help invigorate the market so that it can sustain the growth that it's at without too much inflation the take away from that is the Market's looking for a sector rotation title: 3 Potential Short Squeezes: Stocks to Watch Now
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's been two years since a historic short squeeze took over Wall Street could another stock be poised to do the [Music] same here to talk about three stocks that could make good short squeeze candidates is Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris let's start off by just talking about what is a short squeeze a short squeeze is it's an event that happens s when you have a stock that's being heavily shorted uh which you can usually notice by the short interest ratio on a stock so when it's being heavily shorted but the price goes up instead of down and it usually goes up very quickly instead of going down so that's creates the conditions for the short squeeze the short buyers have to um or the short sellers I should say have to buy the stock at a higher price to cover their short positions and that's exactly what we saw a couple of years ago with that historic GameStop short squeeze I'll walk people through exactly what happened in that situation so you had many people that were shorting GameStop which means they were making a bet that GameStop was going to go lower but instead of going lower through a Confluence of a lot of circumstances which don't have to be talked about here the stock shot up and it shot up high and then what happened was the short sellers had to start chasing the stock higher and more people kept buying it which meant more short sellers had to keep buying it and it just just took on a life of its own and the momentum Bill and it was again it was yeah it was an epic short squeeze right there for some people a very profitable one too very much talk about what these short squeezes can mean for investors if you are on the the buy side of the trade these can be enormously profitable because again um if you bought GameStop let's say when it was at I don't I don't even know I think it started when it was like at $18 and if you bought it and it was at 20 $25 and you just let it ride and it rode all the way up to wherever it got up to yeah you could you could stand to make a lot of money as long as you could get out of the stock before the stock price came back down and that was the issue with GameStop is some people didn't get out of the stock early enough and then they wound up losing all of the gains that they had that's where the risk comes in with the short squeeze so what makes a stock like GameStop poised to do this kind of short squeeze again in the future well you would like to say that there's something that you can pinpoint and say this is why a short squeeze is going to happen ultimately we're in an age where there's a lot of high-speed trading so really it becomes almost a trading event and if Traders decide as happens a lot of times in some of these investing communities like Reddit and Wall Street Bank that's if you get a lot of people who are actively trading in a stock at one period of time it can cause a short squeeze but sometimes it can happen because of events that happened for example a stock could get an unexpected upgrade or you could see a stock that um beats on earnings when it wasn't expected to or they might have had um a settlement of a lawsuit that went in their favor that wasn't supposed to happen and all of those could have been creating interest on the short side but now because the because the outcome was positive it can cause people to jump in and buy the stock instead which can then Force those short sellers to buy the stock you have three stocks that you think could be in this situation we're going to get to those picks in just a minute but first here's a tool you can use to track any stock in your portfolio want to keep your finger on the pulse of the market text the word YouTube to 68 285 that 6 8285 and get free breaking news alerts from Market beat for the stocks that matter most to you don't miss out on crucial updates stay informed and stay ahead all right Chris let's get to your first pick of a stock that you think could potentially see a short squeeze so the first one I had in my article was C3 AI this is a name that's familiar to a lot of investors in the AI space um it's going through a similar issue to Nvidia and I'm not comparing it to Nvidia but I'm saying it's going through a similar issue in that it has delivered good quarterly earnings but not as good as some analysts would like and they've been cautious on their Guidance the issue with C3 AI is they're moving from a subscription-based revenue model which analysts have tended to love over the past few years because it guarantees that predictable Revenue stream that everybody loves to more of a consumption-based approach and right now that's still in the early Innings it's still very tough to gauge how that's going to play out however the company is also taking some some efficiency efforts to try to to make themselves a profitable company because they're not a profitable company yet but all of this is which to say if you have a few profitable quarters coming or if they continue to beat Revenue estimates analysts still have a price Target on the stock that's about 29% higher than where it's at right now and this could be one that has the potential to go much higher and could be something where you don't want to be caught short on it is there enough of a following for this AI stock there's so many out there yeah is there kind of that fan following for this one um I I don't know right now it seems right now that there's more bearish sentiment on it than there's bullish sentiment there seems to be some sort of I would call it maybe an AI fatigue going on right now and some investors are choosing there are one or two stocks that they're going to invest in the AI Circle C3 AI may may be on the outside of that right now but for all the reasons I just said it's one that investors may want to be looking at very carefully especially since analysts have about a 29% upside on the stock NOW your second pck for a stock that could be a good short squeeze candidate is not in the AI realm but it's a brand many people are familiar with right it's RH now the company the the stock ticker RH in the name of theany as RH but many investors may know it better as Restoration Hardware it's a um premium supplier and manufacturer of Home Furnishings so obviously as you would expect uh in 2020 and 2021 the company was doing very well the stock was doing very well as people were buying houses they were relocating they were renovating the houses they did have in fact at one point RH stock went up over $700 a here well yeah it's at 241 right now so it's gone down significantly since then and you would expect that for all of the reasons that we talked about now the housing market is is tighter people who have looked to do Renovations on their home have already done it others that might be looking to do larger Renovations might be holding off waiting for more favorable interest rates waiting for inflation pressures to come down that's where the opportunity May lie we have a we have a federal Federal Reserve that is likely to cut interest rates when they meet next week that may not trickle down to Consumers right away but it is expected that if that happens you might start seeing some loosening up in the housing markets in any event the stocks tend to precede the overall Market by 6 to nine months so now might be an interesting time to get in on RH and if that stock does if the company does happen to improve their earnings Outlook because right now revenue is about at 2019 levels so it's not too bad and it's about where investors might expect to see it the problem is that right now the company their earnings have been negative because the as a company they're facing the pricing pressures that are coming from Supply chains and inflation and all that if that turns around you could see the stock start moving up higher and again it might be an interesting short squeeze candidate now does every short squeeze have to happen with that fan following like we saw in gain stop or can it happen by the kind of economic factors you just talked about yeah I think it can be it can be either one in fact I think what made GameStop so unique was the fact that the short squeeze happened in absence of any real fundamental reason for it happening it was sort of a Mania and again that's that's not to judge it one way or the other it's just to say it did happen without any fundamentals many short squeeze happen because of some fundamental Catalyst and it's also important to note that many short squeezes never get to the level where GameStop as which is again what made GameStop so unique let's get on to your third pick of a good short squeeze candidate what's your final stock okay so the third one I'm not necessarily going to say is my is a good short squeeze candidate in terms of a stock that I would like to own but it's one that I think investors might want to take a look at and it's beyond beyond meat now beyond meat has had a terrible year I think the stock is down 30% this year it's down about 45% in the last 12 months short interest on this stock is a whopping 42% that's a lot of people betting that the stock is going to go lower and they could be right the one of the reasons for that this isn't a critique of the plant-based meat industry plant-based foods are here to stay plant-based products are here to stay and it's and in fact that's the actual issue that's going on with beyond meat was when they came into the market they didn't have a lot of competition now unfortunately even as plant-based products are getting more popularity there's also a lot more competition in the space for Beyond me and it's hard for them to Stand Out Among that competition however the reason why I think it might be a short squeeze candidate is again you've got 42% short interest so you got a lot lot of people that are betting the stocks going to go down however what is what it's looking like is in the next four quarters the companies going to have a lot easier comparisons on the top line they just went through a year where they were having very difficult comparisons where it was going to be very tough for them to beat Revenue expectations from the prior year this year should be a lot easier that being said the company's not profitable I don't expect it to turn a profit this year but just the fact that it could beat those Topline estimates could be enough to convince people to jump in on the stock and again with that high of short interest there could be a squeeze here with beyond meat how big of a squeeze would you think with the short interest you're talking about well I wouldn't if I were an investor in beyond meat right now it's it's trading around $6 a share so it's just over penny stock territory actually the analyst forecasts on Market beat are actually suggesting that stock could still go lower I don't think investors should be looking at this as being like a a $55 $20 stock here but I think if you were looking at the stock and said you could get it to7 8 $9 you're still looking at a very nice profit on that stock and that's what I might be looking at if I were an investor some great information and good stocks to look into thank you so much for the list Chris and thank you for joining us here at Market beat stay with us for more information on all the stocks in your portfolio and as always happy investing [Music]

title: 3 Potential Short Squeezes: Stocks to Watch Now

could make good short squeeze candidates is Market beat analyst Chris marot Chris let's start off by just talking about what is a short squeeze a short squeeze is it's an event that happens s when you have a stock that's being heavily shorted uh which you can usually notice by the short interest ratio on a stock so when it's being heavily shorted but the price goes up instead of down and it usually goes up very quickly instead of going down so that's creates the conditions for the short squeeze the short buyers have to um or the short sellers I should say have to buy the stock at a higher price to cover their short positions and that's exactly what we saw a couple of years ago with that historic GameStop short squeeze I'll walk people through exactly what happened in that situation so you had many people that were shorting GameStop which means they were making a bet that GameStop was going to go lower but instead of going lower through a Confluence of a lot of circumstances which don't have to be talked about here the stock shot up and it shot up high and then what happened was the short sellers had to start chasing the stock higher and more people kept buying it which meant more short sellers had to keep buying it and it just just took on a life of its own and the momentum Bill and it was again it was yeah it was an epic short squeeze right there for some people a very profitable one too very much talk about what these short squeezes can mean for investors if you are on the the buy side of the trade these can be enormously profitable because again um if you bought GameStop let's say when it was at I don't I don't even know I think it started when it was like at $18 and if you bought it and it was at 20 $25 and you just let it ride and it rode all the way up to wherever it got up to yeah you could you could stand to make a lot of money as long as you could get out of the stock before the stock price came back down and that was the issue with GameStop is some people didn't get out of the stock early enough and then they wound up losing all of the gains that they had that's where the risk comes in with the short squeeze so what makes a stock like GameStop poised to do this kind of short squeeze again in the future well you would like to say that there's something that you can pinpoint and say this is why a short squeeze is going to happen ultimately we're in an age where there's a lot of high-speed trading so really it becomes almost a trading event and if Traders decide as happens a lot of times in some of these investing communities like Reddit and Wall Street Bank that's if you get a lot of people who are actively trading in a stock at one period of time it can cause a short squeeze but sometimes it can happen because of events that happened for example a stock could get an unexpected upgrade or you could see a stock that um beats on earnings when it wasn't expected to or they might have had um a settlement of a lawsuit that went in their favor that wasn't supposed to happen and all of those could have been creating interest on the short side but now because the because the outcome was positive it can cause people to jump in and buy the stock instead which can then Force those short sellers to buy the stock you have three stocks that you think could be in this situation we're going to get to those picks in just a minute but first here's a tool you can use to track any stock in your portfolio want to keep your finger on the pulse of the market text the word YouTube to 68 285 that 6 8285 and get free breaking news predictable Revenue stream that everybody loves to more of a consumption-based approach and right now that's still in the early Innings it's still very tough to gauge how that's going to play out however the company is also taking some some efficiency efforts to try to to make themselves a profitable company because they're not a profitable company yet but all of this is which to say if you title: Casey's Stock: Strong Growth and Solid Dividends
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] let's move on to your second stock pick it's one that my children love Casey's uh known for pizza in the Midwest for sure but what about this company makes it a no-brainer hold well right it's not a lot of the same qualities as Centos starting with this business model it sells gas and snacks everybody needs gas for their cars and when you get the gas you got to have some snacks today uh Casey's is also benefiting from a a downward shift and consumer habits um it sells some some pretty good values in food and prepared foods and that's been seen in their results but we have a fundamentally strong company it's growing organically and through Acquisitions it's got a fortress balance sheet it's able to self fund its growth cash flow is robust and sustains Capital return which includes dividends and share BuyBacks which is part of the whole investment thesis look at the chart it's very similar to Centos the stock prices up triple digits and trending upward over the very long term any dips in the price action have turned out to be very good buying opportunities gas and snacks aren't going anywhere anytime soon so we're going to need this company for a while but there are a lot of gas and snack providers out there a lot of competitors what about Casey's business model really sets this stock apart well Casey is doing the same thing that Centos has done in his is doing and that is consolidating a highly fractured Market there's lots of gas stations but there are very few large gas station chains cases is buying gas stations in critical corridors or critical locations which is fueling its growth and widening its margin [Music]

title: Netflixs Bold Moves: 4 Strategies for Explosive Growth
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's the world's largest online streaming service that has seen its fair share of headlines for raising [Music] rates Netflix has introduced a new program that has both users and revenue Rising here to dive into Netflix's latest growth drivers is Market beat analyst jayu Jay commercials are kind of a thing of the past but they seem to be making comeback on Netflix ad supported revenues is basically a game Cher for Netflix for the longest time they've held out from having commercials on their service but once they embrac the uh ad supported programming that's when their growth resumed again they uh were able to basically add 40 million new subscribers in less than a year and it's continuing to grow yeah what is that new advertising model meant for Revenue right so basically with with the ad supported tiers um they are able to do conversion they don't have a free tier anymore so the lowest tier is $6.99 and you have commercials um if you want to get rid of the commercials that's when you can get on a standard tier an upgrade to the 15 uh 45 45 level or the price your premium level it's added new Revenue a new Revenue stream to the company um it's obviously a conversion tool and it's also been able to uh help Netflix expand its reach by bundling its service with basically competitors there are packages out there now where you can get uh adree or or an ad tier Netflix along with Disney plus and Hulu or peacock with Netflix Etc almost like the Cable packages um and this allows Netflix to basically bring new people into their ecosystem yeah as consumers have been noticing these new package deals that yes reminds you a lot of the old cable system for sure of course this new program is designed to bring in those new users at that lower cost of Entry everyone was so upset when Netflix was Raising its rate so much but this is a great point of entry for a lot of new users especially in other countries talk about how Netflix is planning to use this advertising supported content to help get some more of those International viewers right so basically their growth is in in international um they've already almost saturated uh you know North America and Canada uh so they're uh thinking of even putting out an ad free tier overseas now they haven't made any announcements but that would definitely boost user engagement uh and would definitely open open the floodgates for uh people to try Netflix and in the lat quarter they have said that 45% of their new subscribers came in through the uh ad supported tier lowest tier uh where it was available yeah the international growth was one of the growth drivers you mentioned along with the advertising but the third point you mentioned in your article about four growth drivers for Netflix was also about margins talk about how you know the user numbers and the advertising has really impacted their margins right 2017 Netflix only had 7% operating margins um this was before advertised uh now in 20124 uh in their second quarter they recorded a 27.2% operating margin that's come from obvious obviously price hikes uh CRA password crackdowns um operating efficiency and their fixed cost content licensing model uh basically they are buying new shows new programs new content uh at the cost of production plus a 30% premium and this is actually a lot cheaper than TV shows uh where the networks would actually you know buy TV shows uh content for uh production cost plus a 60 to 70% premium and that's all gone straight to the bottom line and obviously their uper margins now let's move on to your fourth point and this is is an area I haven't personally explored on Netflix yet but they're trying to get into video gaming people obviously spending a lot of time which would increase their time on the platform what's Netflix doing to get into that sector a little more so Netflix has been adding video games to their core Service uh this is pretty much meant to uh upgrade its core service and uh improve user engagement times ultimately I think Netflix wants their platform to be well an engagement Tool uh around the block all over uh so as far as these um interactive uh games um they're really focused on having uh mobile users actually um use play these games stay engaged uh with the platform it just means more eyeballs more eyeballs for advertising because they're they can have in-game advertising ultimately they want to have these games done inhouse um and we're not talking AAA rated Studio games we're not talking Final Fantasy or anything like that but you know on a mobile on a mobile app as long as you can keep users engaged um that's going to help their add revenues so what do all of these growth drivers mean for Netflix stock right so basically Netflix has uh been hovering around that 700 area that's actually been a resistance um so when you have a uh resistance area and and the the thing with Netflix is that it had peaked around 6 9749 and then sold off very hard down to the 592 area uh which is also the anchored vlop support and then shot right back up to two all-time highs and is again finding resistance right around that 700 area um and that's called a vbottom so investors looking for uh entry into Netflix should always wait for a pullback their Fibonacci uh price retracement levels that are in the article um and another way of basically being patient to wait for a pullback to enter is by using uh what's known as cash secured puts and uh if once you get assigned if you do have a position you can actually um have some uh income coming in uh by writing covered calls and this is called a wheel Strat details are in the article some useful tools for investors thanks for this dive into Netflix Jay stick with Market be for more information on this stock and many others and as always happy investing [Music]

title: Cintas Stock: The Buy-and-Hold Play for Steady Returns
text: Kind: captions Language: en we talk about the first company that you are looking at as a no-brainer Buy and Hold long-term stock well that's Centos I've been covering Centos for over 12 years it hasn't been much of an exciting company and yet its stock price has increased by quadruple digits while it increases the dividend and buys back shares the dividend increases have the payment up high triple digits in that time um it really is a no-brainer stock it's a stock that you could buy when it's moving up or when it's moving down because you know over time it's going to pay you back so cintos has been around for quite a while but what exactly does this company do and is their business model something that seems like it's going to hold long term well right the thing about the stocks on this list and I said this in the article they've all got these businesses that are really required by the economy and by Society kind of akin to like a dentist or mortician everybody's going to have a cavity now and then just about and everybody's going to need to go to the graveyard sooner or later likewise Centos provides uniform services for a wide range of businesses these businesses which include a lot of restaurants and other service Industries don't have the time or the capability to wash their towels and wash their uniforms so they really require Centos and their business and Centos is adding value by acquiring ancillary businesses one of the more recent ones that happened a few years ago was zal Z medal provides first aid supplies to the very same businesses that centas was serving so that acquisition not only provided Cintas um an added growth opportunity but there was a lot of cross- selling opportunities Z clients that weren't using Centos are now using Centos Centos clients that weren't using Z are now using Z good Partnerships always make for good business [Music]

title: 3 No-Brainer Stock Picks For The Long-Haul
text: Kind: captions Language: en in a market filled with volatility it's good to have a sure thing to hold on to or at least the closest thing to it here to talk about three no-brainer stocks to buy and hold long-term is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes first off what are some fundamentals you look for in choosing a stock that's good to hold on to long term that you know is not going to be a problem well you want to start with the balance sheet you want it to be healthy and possibly in a fortress condition you want them to have strong cash flow you want to see them growing and to top it off some Capital return helps out a whole lot in the current economic conditions we're in is there such a thing as a sure thing is there is any company have some level of risk with it well all stocks come with risk it's impossible to know where the price is going to go from minute to minute or day to day but you want to look for these strong fundamentally sound companies because they provide steady returns over the long term which is critical for Buy and Hold portfolios should every portfolio have some of these solid stocks that you can hold for many years to come well I I can't say that because I don't know what each portfolio is targeting but investors that are looking to build their retirement income would do well to focus on some no-brainer stocks well let's get to your picks Thomas uh talk about the first company that you are looking at as a no brainer Buy and Hold long-term stock well that's Centos I've been covering Centos for over 12 years it hasn't been much of an exciting company and yet its stock price has increased by quadruple digits while it increases the dividend and buys back shares the dividend increases have the payment up high triple digits in that time um it really is a no-brainer stock it's a stock that you could buy when it's moving up or when it's moving down because you know over time it's going to pay you back so as cintos has been around for quite a while but what exactly does this company do and is their business model something that seems like it's going to hold long term all right the thing about the stocks on this list and I said this in the article they've all got these businesses that are really required by the economy and by Society kind of akin to like a dentist or a mortician everybody's going to have a cavity now and then just about and everybody's going to need to go to the graveyard sooner or later likewise Centos provides uniform servic is for a wide range of businesses these businesses which include a lot of restaurants and other service Industries don't have the time or the capability to wash their towels and wash their uniforms so they really require Centos and their business and Centos is adding value by acquiring ancillary businesses uh one of the more recent ones that happened a few years ago was zedal Z medal provides first aid supplies to the very same businesses that Centos was serving so that acquisition not only provided Cintas um an added growth opportunity but there was a lot of cross- selling opportunities Z clients that weren't using Centos are now using Centos Centos clients that weren't using Z are now using Z good Partnerships always make for good business for sure let's move on to your second stock pick it's one that my children love Casey's uh known for pizza in the Midwest for sure but what about this company makes a no-brainer hold well right it's got a lot of the same qualities as Centos starting with its business model it sells gas and snacks everybody needs gas for their cars and when you get the gas you got to have some snacks today uh Casey is also benefiting from a a downward Shi and consumer habits um it sells some some pretty good values in food and prepared foods and that's been seen in their results but we have a fundamentally strong company it's growing organically and through Acquisitions it's got Fortress balance sheet it's able to self fund its growth cash flow is robust and sustains Capital return which includes dividends and share BuyBacks which is part of the whole investment thesis if you look at the chart it's very similar to Centos the stock pric is up triple digits and trending upward over the very long term any dips in the price action have turned out to be very good buying opportunities gas and snacks aren't going anywhere anytime soon so we're going to need this company for a while but there are a lot of of gas and snack providers out there a lot of competitors what about Casey's business model really sets this stock apart well cases is doing the same thing that cintos has done and is doing and that is consolidating a highly fractured Market there's lots of gas stations but there are very few large gas station chains case's is buying gas stations in critical corridors or critical locations which is fueling its growth and widening its margin that's a solid second no-brainer pick to buy and hold forever but let's go on to your final pick this company may be a little less known than others Shopify I wouldn't put it quite in the same category as Centos and and Casey's it is a must need must have service for small business and even large businesses because it provides a digital footprint it helps them with their e-commerce and with crossb sales um Shopify right now is growing at a high double-digit Pace it's not yet returning Capital but it's Balan she is a fortress so I would expect to see Capital Returns come in time so right now what we're looking at is an outperforming grow story that's got its stock price in a reversal with an expectation for some Capital return to come in time which will be a very great cist for its share price and this stock seems like a little bit a lower point of entry than the other picks that you mentioned right Shopify really got a boost during the pandemic because of the whole e-commerce craze its valuation has come down since then but the real takeaway is that it has continued to outperform consensus even while its price targets were coming down so now it's set up to have a pretty nice rebound and that's being fueled by recent results which show it outperforming and growing and raising Guidance Do you see this company and their business plan really lasting long term much like the gas or the needs for businesses like cintos has does this company have a a business plan that is really a long term plan yes it does and you have to think about the internet and e-commerce the internet's not going anywhere it's only becoming more entrenched in our lives e-commerce is the same way businesses that want to compete and stay relevant today have to have e-commerce and their go-to sources Shopify these are some great no-brainer picks for our viewers to look at thanks for diving in and sharing some more about these stocks thanks for joining us here on marketbeat media stick with us for more info on all the stocks in your portfolio and as always happy investing [Music]

apart well cases is doing the same thing that cintos has done and is doing and that is consolidating a highly fractured Market there's lots of gas stations but there are very few large gas station chains case's is buying gas stations in critical corridors or critical locations which is fueling its growth and widening its margin that's a solid second no-brainer pick to buy and hold forever but let's go on to your final pick this company may be a little less known than others Shopify I wouldn't put it quite in the same category as Centos and and Casey's it is a must need must have service for small business and even large businesses because it provides a digital footprint it helps them with their e-commerce and with crossb sales um Shopify right now is growing at a high double-digit Pace it's not yet returning Capital but it's Balan she is a fortress so I would expect to see Capital Returns come in time so right now what we're looking at is an outperforming grow story that's got its stock price in a reversal with an expectation for some Capital return to come in time which will be a very great cist for its share price and this stock seems like a little bit a lower point of entry than the other picks that you mentioned right Shopify really got a boost during the pandemic because of the whole e-commerce craze its valuation has come down since then but the real takeaway is title: Racing to the Skies: Joby Aviations Air Taxi Future
text: Kind: captions Language: en it may sound like science fiction but air taxis are no longer just an idea competition is already underway to get this industry off the ground here to talk about the air taxi race and a new leader in the program is Market beat analyst jayu Jay we talked last month about Archer Aviation and their plans to start manufacturing more air taxis this year building their own plant and then getting their Air Taxi program off the ground in 2026 but there is another market leader who has a plan to start even sooner than that yes job Aviation uh actually has a first mover Advantage they've been testing their prototype a lot longer uh they've already put in 33,000 miles uh they are in stage four of their five-stage certification process with the FAA they are looking to launch their Air Taxi Network in 2025 they want to start off with New York LA and Dubai that is not far off either that's next year already but I'm sure the certification process is really one of the things still up in the air about whether this program will take off on the timeline they're hoping absolutely the FAA certification is the wild card now they are in stage four right now of the five-stage certification process they're about 37% through uh the FAA is about 14% through uh it's takes both the uh eeve M maker and the FAA they both are uh involved in the process in stage five they're only about 2% through but once they get through the five stage certification then it's on to commercialization now let's talk about what commercialization is actually going to look like for consumers especially it sounds like this program is going to function just like taxis or ride share service in fact Joby is actually partnering with Uber for this project right in 2020 Joby actually acquired Uber Elevate which was uh Uber's own air taxi Division and by bringing on the Uber Elevate team they helped to program its software program called Elevate OS and this uh software uh infrastructure also has a rider app just like the Uber app and a pilot app and the engine will go ahead and match the riders with the pilots with the uh evall uh destination flights and in fact Uber has already integrated it into their uh their app that they've been testing uh where it will basically involve the whole travel sequence so you'll be able to order your Uber ride or a uh air taxi um to the airport you'll be able to actually book your flights or book your Delta flights um as well uh and then once you get to the airport once you land uh you'll once again be able to book your Uber Uber rides uh air taxis um you know or whatever destination you want to go to yeah it sounds like a very familiar process just like the Uber you might use right now the only difference with this Air Taxi program it would be a lot faster for consumers absolutely there uh as 4 prototype can go up to about 200 milph uh it's operated by One Pilot and it can accommodate up to four passengers and their goal is to get your travel time down quite a bit talk about that Jay sure they want to basically shrink maybe a 45 minute car ride down to a 7 minute air taxi ride that would be a big time save for a lot of people especially in those metropolitan areas but I think to make this program successful they really need to have a lot of air taxis available let's move into manufacturing what is Joby doing to get enough of these to start this program successfully so job's been uh partnered with Toyota who also happens to be their largest largest outside shareholder Toyota's already invested about $400 million um they will be providing a lot of the components the power Trin uh and also advising them on their whole manufacturing process joob wants to be a completely vertically integrated manufacturer of EV TOS now their current model that they're manufacturing right now this is the one that's for those shorter commutes you know getting you across New York to JFK Airport in a really quick time frame but talk about the future plans this company has for air taxis maybe going a little bit further than just those you know in City commutes well Electric aircraft EV ts are ideal for uh congested City traffic and uh the suburbs but job is actually looking to go even further than that and provide Regional flights Regional Air taxis uh so they've actually created a first of its kind a hydrogen EV tall uh which is outfitted with um a whole hydrogen fuel system and 40 kg of liquid hydrogen and they put it on a flight and they uh ran it for 523 mies which is a world record um just to prove that it is possible to be able to handle Regional flights uh when you have a hydrogen fuel system um and it's something that they're looking looking to uh to launch down the road so that you can take uh you know a an air taxi actually from um Boston to New York or from New York to Washington DC um Detroit to Nashville this is their long-term plan it's all exciting plans to hear but right now it's still just an idea this program hasn't taken off yet so talk about what that means for investors who might be looking into joby's stock as an investment opportunity what should they expect for this kind of a speculative buy as you call it yes this stock is absolutely speculative you should only be using risk Capital really money you could burn you can burn because this is a pre Revenue company so if you are interested uh you can keep take a look at the Candlestick chart and be aware of the descending triangle pattern which is comprised of lower highs after Joby made its recent swing high at 769 all the bounces have been smaller and smaller and smaller um so that's known as a descending trend line it's a descending upper trend line uh up meeting a flat bottom support it's a horizontal trend line so when you connect those lines it forms what's known as a descending triangle pattern uh Jo has found support pretty much around five area so uh if it breaks down under five then there's potential pullback support areas that are in the article that uh investors can look at to consider taking a position if they know that it is it is a high-risk speculation um they could also consider using an option strategy uh that will basically force them to wait for a pullback um a cash secured put can be used um if you want to limit your the amount of your investment you can always consider taking uh long calls uh for a fraction of the price of the stock um but the strategies are available some great tools for investors as always Jay and a really interesting dive into this speculative stock that I think everyone is excited to to see if they can actually pull it off it'll be a game changer for sure thanks again for this deep dive into Joby Aviation stick with Market be as we continue to follow this stock and many others as always happy investing [Music]

title: September Sell-Off: Market Panic or Opportunity?
text: Kind: captions Language: en September started off with a market selloff with most stocks down two to 10% in just a day here to break down what's behind the dip is Market beat analyst Thomas Hughes Thomas I don't think anyone was hoping September or their return from Labor Day weekend would start out quite like this well I don't think anybody wanted it to happen but it's been pretty well telegraphed by the market we've been anticipating um at least a volatile September and right now it looks like it could be a significantly down month and just how down did we see stocks tumble yesterday well the S&P 500 fell 2% so as an average so most S&P 500 companies including the leaders like Nvidia fell much more than 2% let's talk about Nvidia they've had a really rough week since their earnings report which was actually pretty good right the report was great it was what the market wanted but the market was expecting it one thing the market pricing in the peak of AI growth but it's being compounded by sector rotation which is ultimately why the market sold off yesterday so how far has Nvidia Fallen since earnings yeah so Nvidia is down 25 to 30% since the earnings report and it could possibly move lower right now uh Nvidia is still amongst the most crowded trades on the market everybody's been buying that stock for the last two years and with seor rotation and play it's possible that the selloff could continue for many weeks until the last person has been able to get out of their shares let's get to what's behind this selloff why are people selling this strong company and and others too all right so let's back up uh the selloff on Monday is really an extension of the sell off that began in July with the CPI report now the CPI report was cooler than expected it aligned with the idea of the fomc cutting rates and since then the fomc has indicated that rate cuts are very likely they may not cut them this month but they are expected to cut rates before the end of the year which signals a shift in economic policy and fundamental quality for the market and what that means is easing headwinds which is expected to lead to growth in the small cap sector so back to sector rotation people need to sell out of the winners that have been winning for the last two years which includes Nvidia and most of the big AI names in order to prepare to buy small cap stocks so last month when we saw a similar dip there was a huge rise in the fear index what are we seeing right now this week yeah well right now the fear index looks pretty scary the fear index is confirming support at a higher level it made a significant rise along with the market selloff and my character my characterization of the move is that it looks more deliberate than the one before in July it was a run for the Hills and fear and right now what I'm seeing is the market kind of gearing up for a sustained move move higher which could lead to a significant correction in the market um in this environment the S&P 500 could fall seven and a half to 10% easily and up to 20% before it's all said and done those are some scary numbers for investors to be looking at what can you do in an environment like this as an investor to try and protect your Investments but maybe also continue investing and and try to make a profit during this kind of economic time well you want to start with a good Diversified portfolio that includes some Buy and Hold no-brainer stocks uh right now you're going to want to look at fundamental quality and capital returns that include some uh possibly low beta stocks to kind of mitigate some of that downside risk But ultimately what I see happening is another buy the dip opportunity the difference between now and the last few is that this dip could be much larger than what we've seen over the last two years um but I think investors should just stay the course uh build up some Capital Target their favorite Buy and Hold stocks and and buy them when they present opportunities we are just about 10 days away from that Fed rate cut at least the one that's expected will whatever comes out of that announcement really impact the market again or is what we're seeing just a lead up to that decision I think it's just a lead up to the decision um the CPI report suggested that the shift and fomc policy was really a sell the news event the sell off yesterday kind of confirms that idea uh what we're going to want to see the fomc do uh this month is to cut rates more than the market expects which is probably not going to happen because there are still signs of fundamental strength in the market including the labor data uh the labor data has been very resilient gives the fomc really no reason to need to cut rates so with inflation still above their target rate and only falling ever so slowly it's possible they'll hold off for another month and they may not cut rates at all we will have to hold on and see what the market does if that is the case thank you Thomas for diving into this week's Market dip and the big selloff underway be sure to like And subscribe as we continue to follow all of the market moves right here on Market beat thanks for joining us and as always happy investing [Music]

it's being compounded by sector rotation which is ultimately why the market sold off yesterday so how far has Nvidia Fallen since earnings yeah so Nvidia is down 25 to 30% since the earnings report and it could possibly move lower right now uh Nvidia is still amongst the most crowded trades on the market everybody's been buying that stock for the last two years and with seor rotation and play it's possible that the selloff could continue for many weeks until the last person has been able to get out of their shares let's get to what's behind this selloff why are people selling this strong company and and others too all right so let's back up uh the selloff on Monday is really an extension of the sell off that began in July with the CPI report now the CPI report was cooler than expected it aligned with the idea of the fomc cutting rates and since then the fomc has indicated that rate cuts are very likely they may not cut them this month but they are expected to cut rates before the end of the year which signals a shift in economic policy and fundamental quality for the market and what that means is easing headwinds which is expected to lead to growth in the small cap sector so back to sector rotation people need to sell out of the winners that have been winning for the last two years which includes Nvidia and most of the big AI names in order to prepare to buy small cap stocks so last month when we saw a similar dip there was a huge rise in the fear index what are we seeing right now this week yeah well right now the fear index looks pretty scary the fear index is confirming support at a higher level it made a significant rise along with the market selloff and my character my characterization of the move is that it looks more deliberate than the one before in July it was a run for the Hills and fear and right now what I'm seeing is the market kind of gearing up for a sustained move move higher which could lead to a significant correction in the market um in this environment the S&P 500 could fall seven and a half to 10% easily and up to 20% before it's all said and done those are some scary numbers for investors to be looking at what can you do in an environment like this as an investor to try and protect your Investments but maybe also continue investing and and try to make a profit during this kind of economic time well you want to start with a stocks to kind of mitigate some of that downside risk But ultimately what I see happening is another buy the dip opportunity the difference between now and the last few is that this dip could be much title: Why Monday.com Is A Top AI-Powered Stock to Buy
text: Kind: captions Language: en monday.com is monetizing AI today. All right. It is a good example of what we've been expecting for the second wave of AI. [Music] Want to hear your buy picks and I really want to know the why, too. Uh Thomas, let's get to your first buy pick. All right. My buy pick is monday.com. monday.com is a workflow automation platform. Um it's resonating with clients because it's easy to use and it scales well. It's got this plug-and-play quality where you can just kind of pick which segments of it you want to use. You build them together to create your own workflow. So, this past quarter was a beat and raise quarter. Revenue was up 35%. 300 basis points better than expected. That revenue strength was driven on new clients and penetration. Their net retention rate is 110% which means that existing clients are spending 10% more this year than last year with the addition of new clients which will also increase their spending over the next year provides some leverage for growth. Uh margins are widening with that leverage and the efficiency that the company is working towards. Um adjusted operating income was up 130%. That's a real good example of how that leverage can affect your investment quality. um adjusted earnings of 94 cents were 6 6,700 basis points better than expected 67%. That's huge. That's a huge outperformance. Um the company also raised guidance. This has raised guidance again. This is like the third time this year. Momentum is clearly building. Also the balance sheet is a super fortress. It's net cash. Total liability is less than 0.5 the cash position less compared to assets. Shareholder equity is rising. I think it's only a matter of time before capital returns come into play. And then there's the analyst response. All those things are great, but without the analyst, the upside potential is really limited. The analyst response is overwhelmingly bullish. They're leading the stock higher. It's got about 20% upside at consensus. We're going to expect it to go above consensus because of the revision trends. And what I see in the stock price right now is a retest of the all-time highs that may come as soon as this year. And that's a 35% upside at least. And where is the entry point right now if you are just looking at getting into monday.com? So right now, Monday.com stock is trending higher and it moved up to set a new multi-year high on this past this past report. So, not to chase the price higher, but you're going to want to get in probably pretty soon. Wait for any kind of pullback in the action as your entry point and then just start to slowly build a position with time. I would certainly expect to see this stock retest the all-time highs and within the next year or two, you set a new all-time high and then continue this trend um upward. Chris, have you followed monday.com? What do you think of that pick? I haven't followed it quite as closely as Thomas has, but it's a stock that's very intriguing to me. And I think one of the reasons why, and I'll just keep my answer a little bit shorter, Bridget, is just, you know, you're talk when you talk about looking for buy stocks, you're talking about, as the saying goes, you try to skate where the puck is moving. And Monday is certainly right in that sweet spot. You know, remote work is not something that's going away. uh it may not exist in the same form and fashion that it exists today over the next 10 years, but it's not going away. And that's exactly the type of business that monday.com is going to work for very well in terms of you need the tools that to make it easy for teams to collaborate with with each other no matter where they are. Yeah. One of the points that I forgot to hit on is that monday.com is monetizing AI today. All right. It is a good example of what we've been expecting for the second wave of AI where Nvidia and the chip makers are the the leading edge the first wave with infrastructure. Monday is actually using AI and they're monetizing it for themselves and for their clients which is huge because the monetization of services is going to be the largest fastest growing segment of AI which is saying something considering Nvidia's you know rapid rise over the last two years. [Music]

paler as a long-term hold where where might the stock be in 5 years in 10 years and I just think that right now it's okay to go ahead and buy at $30 if you believe that in five or 10 years it might be at $5 $50 or even higher [Music]

title: Nvidia's Stellar Earnings: Can It Keep Up the Pace?
text: Kind: captions Language: en had a home run but the market was really expecting a grand slam last earnings report Nvidia saw over 260% growth and even though 122% growth is still impressive it's not you know what they had last quarter right and so um the the fundamental argument against Nvidia is fundamentals it's the valuation people are just saying the stock is just unreal reasonably overvalued one of the uh principles I guess that's being used to justify that is something called The Law of large numbers uh this is a statistical concept that's based on probabilities and such this is a table that shows the last several years of nvidia's earnings reports and this is where we were last night the 30.4 billion 30.4 billion in Revenue that they generated in the last quarter and that compares as you can see very favorably 122% higher than the 13.51% billion that they generated in the same quarter in the previous year now look at all of these numbers down here and those are significantly lower than that and now look at next quarter where it was 18.12 billion what would Nvidia have to hit to generate even 122% growth above and beyond that and I think that's where the so the law of large numbers is basically saying Nvidia is going to eventually they're going to regress to a mean now that mean is not necessarily going to be down at those six and7 billion numbers that they once were but what they're saying is it's unrealistic to expect Nvidia to continue growing at the rate they're growing even at the 122% and so therefore it doesn't justify the price to earnings that they currently have or the price to sales that they have Bridget you and I were talking right before we came on I said it's like a batting average in baseball if you have a player who's ever hit 350 before hitting 350 for an extended period of time eventually people are going to say well no eventually they're going to start hitting back to whatever their statistical average was that's what's going on here with Nvidia is people are just saying it's not necessarily that the stock had that the company had a bad report it's just that statistically it's almost impossible for them to keep doing what they're doing right like the runup in stock price over the last two years is because the earnings were growing they were outperforming in a way that was above the market expectation and contined to accelerate this goes along with what I was saying with the peak in Market sentiment nvidia's business hasn't stopped growing but the market has stopped expecting it to grow at a wicked H pace and what we're looking forward to now is industry normalization eventually all of these new data centers will be built out and all the orders to replace the old chips will have have been made in that scenario what will happen to Nvidia is that its business will normalize and the question is at what level will it normalize it's going to come back from the Peaks that it is now how far will it fall back and where will it stabilize investors still have to remember that Nvidia has 85% market share their profit margins are still over 70% and no there's no competitor that's immediately positioned to take over the premium Market that they have so even if companies are looking to Pivot away from Nvidia they're still going to be likely to pay the premium price for nvidia's premium products [Music]

across uh I don't know if it was I it was probably like right around the time the market closed last night uh super micro is delaying the release of their 10K um there's a report that's coming out stellar earnings report 122% growth year-over-year Thomas why is that growth not transl in to a runup in the stock right now well because with the trends and the forecast and the revision Trend and the expectations the report was really nothing but what the market wanted and the market is a front running forward-looking machine what we're seeing right now is a peak in Market sentiment which is going to be a pretty substantial headwind for the the price of the stock I think over the next month or two now last night in our video reacting to just the earnings report Chris you mentioned that they had a home run but the market was really expecting a grand slam and I do think that that's the case last earnings report Nvidia saw over 260% growth and even though 122% growth is still impressive it's not you know what they had last quarter right and so um the the fundamental argument against Nvidia is fundamentals it's the valuation people are just saying the stock is just unreasonably overvalued one of the uh principles I guess that's being used to justify that is something called The Law of large numbers uh this is a statistical concept that's based on probabilities and such this is a table that shows the last several years of nvidia's earnings reports and this is where we were last night the 30.4 billion 30.4 billion in Revenue that they generated in the last quarter and that compares as you can see very favorably 122% higher than the 13 .51 billion that they generated in the same quarter in the previous year now look at all of these numbers down here and those are significantly lower than that and now look at next quarter where it was 18.12 billion what would Nvidia have to hit to generate even 122% growth above and beyond that and I think that's where the so the law of large numbers is basically saying Nvidia is going to eventually they're going to regress to a mean now that mean is not necessarily going to be down at those six and seven billion dollar numbers that they once were but what they're saying is it's unrealistic to expect Nvidia to continue growing at the rate they're growing even at the 122% and so therefore it doesn't justify the price to earnings that they currently have or the price to sales that they have Bridget you and I were talking right before we came on I said it's like a batting average in baseball if you have a player who's never hit 350 before hitting 350 for an extended period of time eventually people are going to say well no eventually they're going to start hitting back to whatever their statistical average was that's what's going on here with Nvidia is people are just saying it's not necessarily that the stock had that the company had a bad report it's just that statistically it's almost impossible for them to keep doing what they're doing right like the run up in stock price over the last two years is because the earnings were growing they were outperform forming in a way that was above the market expectation and continued to accelerate this goes along with what I was saying with the peak in Market sentiment nvidia's business hasn't stopped growing but the market has stopped expecting it to grow at a wicked out pace and what we're looking forward to now is the industry normalization eventually all of these new data centers will be built out and all the orders to replace the old chips will have have been made in that scenario what will happen to Nvidia is that its business will normalize and the question is at what level will it normalize it's going to come back from the Peaks that it is now how far will it fall back and where will it stabilize investors still have to remember that Nvidia has 85% market share their profit margins are still over 70% and no there's no competitor that's immediately positioned to take over the premium Market that they have so even if companies are looking to Pivot away from Nvidia they're still going to be likely to pay the premium price for nvidia's premium products let's Shi to the earnings call that happened there was some pretty big news about Blackwell in that report yeah they announced that they shipped out the first of the sample models and they're planning to start ramping production in Q4 they didn't really say specifically when or how much production will ramp uh and there is still some concern about delays now this concern is showing up in in in the price action for stocks like Dell and super micro which rely on those chips to build out their servers so there is some concern that there will be some server buildout delay that could impact the construction of new data centers and the build out of AI infrastructure over the next year that will certainly impact the outlook for all of these stocks including Nvidia so all of that considered and all this growth on the horizon what will it take for investors to be impressed with nvidia's growth in the future if 122% growth isn't enough to to satisfy what can Nvidia do to satisfy the what the market would like to see I mean right now what it looks like is they'll need to make another revolutionary advance in technology to to reignite a new Revolution in technology uh because right now what's happened is that Revolution is underway and what we've seen over the last two years is just the ramp in the expectations and now what we're seeing is those expectations are kind of topping out and that's going to impact the price action I think earlier Chris mentioned the valuation of the stock NOW Nvidia is not exactly comparable to names like apple and Amazon and Microsoft because it's still younger has not quite matured the way that they have but looking forward its 2026 price multiple is about 33 or 34 times earnings which puts it right in alignment with the valuation for Blue Chip tech stocks today which means that all of its growth is probably priced in it will need to come up with something new in order to reinvigorate Market sentiment so unless they have another major Tech announcement coming I think we can expect what Chris had said which is that a little bit more normalized growth as they evolve as a company uh so is this a company that you want to get into if they're reaching that Peak and point in their lifespan investors kind of have to look at this like don't fight the trend and in the immediate aftermath of the earnings report we don't know what that trend is going to be I still tend to think that it's going to it's going to rise above where it closed yesterday um but right now the would be looking to buy any dip in Nvidia I don't think I would be chasing it too much higher but I'd be looking to buy on dips right the analysts are responding favorably they're raising their price title: Disney's Magic Return? Here's What's Ahead For The Stock

CEO that turnaround uh the return of Iger was huge news for this business that's been gaining traction ever since he got back on board uh they brought back the capital return turn that was a huge move um right now the parks are struggling but they're still growing entertainment is growing and streaming is turning profitable which is really the big story this year we're kind of in wait and SE mode to see how the next couple of quarters unfold because consumers are under pressure and there's certainly some pressure on the company's ability to grow and to profit but uh they've got some some big catalysts I think in the works that are going to help with results in the near term and set it up for some big leverage gains in the long term now among those uh The Wolverine and Deadpool movie did very very well so that's certainly going to show up in the next quarter's results um they've been opening a lot of new attractions and Parks send it around Avatar and Indiana Jones and some of the other hotter franchises that should help sustain activity if not growth in the Parks until the consumer rebound takes traction again and then there are also some new films in the work they've got Avatar and The Incredibles and Moana which are all going to be driving results for this company later on in the year now interest rates are supposed to fall soon and that will be a Tailwind I think for the business it may be a year or more before that impact starts to show up in Disney's results but again with prices where they are right now they're kind of at Rock Bottom we have Capital returns back in play I think it's a good stock to hold if you've been to Disney recently especially one of the theme parks it looks like they're doing quite well those lines are never short I do want to hear your opinion on that Chris do you have a different take on Disney well I price fund a little bit Bridget because Bri Disney was the stock that I put as my cell and I think that's where we're going report we saw a couple of quarters ago was a signed that the company was turning the corner they may still be but right now I'm just I'm struggling to figure out what the company's long-term strategy really seems to be right now it just feels like a lot of it is they're relying on Iger and the idea of we're Disney and we've done it before and we'll do it again and I'm hearing a lot of things like well we think this is going to happen we hope this is going to happen the company struggling to get all the parts of the business firing on all cylinders and I think the theme park is a really good place to start profits right now are being used to help get that streaming business up to a level of profitability but there is concern and the company stated it in their last earnings report that demand for the theme parks is starting to show some cracks revenue from the division was only up about 2% and that was at about 8.3 billion and the operating income fell to about 2.2 billion this income that they drive from the park is about 53% of Disney's total revenue and Disney management reported that the next few quarters would be challenging for that division so I don't know it the title: NVIDIAs Impressive Earnings: Stock Dips, Whats Ahead?

was hoping for and a little bit more I mean they grew by 122% year-over-year that outpaced the consensus by 1,000 basis points gross margin widened by 500 basis points operating income is up 175% EPS is up almost 170% it outperformed as well the guidance is strong calling for another quarter of 100% growth I think that's about 2500 basis points better than expected within all of this the cash flow is robust the cash on the balance sheet nearly doubled and they did a surprise $7.2 billion share by back which is going to be highly supportive of the stock over time because now we're going to expect that to happen from on a quarter to quarter basis they've got the cash flow they should be able to continue repurchasing shares and paying dividends at this same Pace yeah tellas that's exactly what you said Nvidia needed to do is really outperform everyone's expectations and it looks like they have in a pretty big way let's talk about Revenue first Chris it looks really impressive yeah I mean they everybody was looking to see if Nvidia was was going to not only beat but if they were going to beat by a large margin and they did um $30 billion in Revenue like Thomas said that's 122% higher than higher year-over-year earnings came in even better because at 67 cents per share they were estimated to come in at on on the market beat site we're saying the consensus estimate was 59 cents a share and year-over-year last year in the same quarter they were at 27 cents this year so they're just crushing it that way they were predicting um margins I see at 70 % uh they're projecting for the full year so they're not going to slow down as far as earnings growth goes and I also noticed that they're talking now that blackwall ship chips are going to ship in the fourth quarter so investors can look forward to that in the next quarter yeah right I would say that the results really are strong all the way through yeah all segments produce growth now obviously the computer and or the Computing and network segment did the best that's where the data center uh segment is data center is up 154% but even Automotive is up 37% and OEM is up 33% they've got double digit gains in the of the stock which I think is probably not the right thing to do but it's probably just this little near-term knee-jerk reaction to okay it wasn't like so mind-bendingly good right we're going to sell but with a solid report like this can they satisfy people enough to help lift the whole Market I think that Nvidia stock will be well supported there may be some volatility over the next month just because it is the end of the summer we're going into September um if you think about you know this idea of sell in May and go away September is when people come back and that's when they start getting back into the market so we may see some profit taking and some repositioning September is typically a bad month for stocks in general but especially so for the chip sector all that aside the underlying fundamentals with with Nvidia are more than robust so this stock really should continue to move higher once we get past what could be a little bit of volatility I think like Thomas said I think investors are waiting to hear what Jensen Wong has to say on the conference call I think one of the things that they want to hear is they want to hear the words come out of his mouth that demand for AI is strong because there's been some sentiment coming into this report that maybe companies were going to start um slowing down on their AI spend as as the economy might be getting weaker but I'm not sure that that is supported by nvidia's results but I think investors still want to hear the words they want to hear AI spending is strong and they expect that to be strong for their customers
