was hoping for and a little bit more I mean they grew by 122% year-over-year that outpaced the consensus by 1,000 basis points gross margin widened by 500 basis points operating income is up 175% EPS is up almost 170% it outperformed as well the guidance is strong calling for another quarter of 100% growth I think that's about 2500 basis points better than expected within all of this the cash flow is robust the cash on the balance sheet nearly doubled and they did a surprise $7.2 billion share by back which is going to be highly supportive of the stock over time because now we're going to expect that to happen from on a quarter to quarter basis they've got the cash flow they should be able to continue repurchasing shares and paying dividends at this same Pace yeah tellas that's exactly what you said Nvidia needed to do is really outperform everyone's expectations and it looks like they have in a pretty big way let's talk about Revenue first Chris it looks really impressive yeah I mean they everybody was looking to see if Nvidia was was going to not only beat but if they were going to beat by a large margin and they did um $30 billion in Revenue like Thomas said that's 122% higher than higher year-over-year earnings came in even better because at 67 cents per share they were estimated to come in at on on the market beat site we're saying the consensus estimate was 59 cents a share and year-over-year last year in the same quarter they were at 27 cents this year so they're just crushing it that way they were predicting um margins I see at 70 % uh they're projecting for the full year so they're not going to slow down as far as earnings growth goes and I also noticed that they're talking now that blackwall ship chips are going to ship in the fourth quarter so investors can look forward to that in the next quarter yeah right I would say that the results really are strong all the way through yeah all segments produce growth now obviously the computer and or the Computing and network segment did the best that's where the data center uh segment is data center is up 154% but even Automotive is up 37% and OEM is up 33% they've got double digit gains in the graphic section uh so yeah this is just a strong report all the way around I think everyone's breathing a little sigh of relief because this is what they were looking for but what happened at the or the end of the close today why did nvidia's stock drop right before this Stellar report came out well even saying that the results are all that the market wanted them more the market was kind of wanting that it was expecting that because that is the trend so this is turning into a little bit of a sell the news event but the question is are people selling the news because it's time to get out of the stock which I think is probably not the right thing to do but it's probably just this little near-term knee-jerk reaction to okay it wasn't like so mind-bendingly good right we're going to sell off a little bit the market will regroup a little bit but then I believe the rally will continue High I would be very surprised if this thing doesn't uh pop much higher in the pre-market tomorrow I think this is a this is a great place and then the highspeed algorithms are going to come in in the morning and clean up whatever dip this is I think they're going to eat that right up this is this this report was too good to ignore I mean this was like Thomas said this was everything the market was expecting and that may not have been enough to satisfy some investors but there's absolutely no reason for people to be selling Nvidia right now right some of this postmarket dip could be because Traders are waiting for the conference call the conference call will have lots of more details and insight than what the the initial release is going to give and SO waiting for that probably a good idea too right yeah we'll break that all down here on Market beat as well after that earnings call tomorrow um but what do we expect the market to do over the next few weeks I think we talked about we expected some kind of volatility with this earnings report just because everyone is watching it but with a solid report like this can they satisfy people enough to help lift the whole Market I think that Nvidia stock will be well supported there may be some volatility over the next month just because it is the end of the summer we're going into September um if you think about you know this idea of sell in May and go away September is when people come back and that's when they start getting back into the market so we may see some profit taking and some repositioning September is typically a bad month for stocks in general but especially so for the chip sector all that aside the underlying fundamentals with with Nvidia are more than robust so this stock really should continue to move higher once we get past what could be a little bit of volatility I think like Thomas said I think investors are waiting to hear what Jensen Wong has to say on the conference call I think one of the things that they want to hear is they want to hear the words come out of his mouth that demand for AI is strong because there's been some sentiment coming into this report that maybe companies were going to start um slowing down on their AI spend as as the economy might be getting weaker but I'm not sure that that is supported by nvidia's results but I think investors still want to hear the words they want to hear AI spending is strong and they expect that to be strong for their customers right also when the in the um the conference call we'll probably hear some more news at about deals and Partnerships the company has been making New Deals and Partnerships I mean seems like on a week- toe basis for the last two years soon it's going to have a deal with every important major company on the market today and just further cement its position as uh Central to the AI infrastructure y well thank you both for breaking down the earnings report from Nvidia good news for the company today but still more to come in the call that's happening this evening we will break down what Market reacts to tomorrow right here on Market beat thanks for watching and happy investing [Music]

title: Tesla Stock: Profits vs. PriceIs It Time to Sell?
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's still the leading EV OEM it makes profits the balance sheet is healthy but which stock are you looking at selling right now well this might be one that Chris won't agree with but I'm looking to sell Tesla all right it's still the leading evem it makes profits the balance sheet is healthy but the core business is Contracting they're still deep in the price Wars margins are Contracting earnings are suffering the valuation is still very high I personally am a fan of Elon Musk but the Elon Musk factor is pricey it's expensive to buy the stock and right now the market is waiting and hoping for the next phase of growth that may come soon but I don't really expect to see any good news out of the EV segment without a groundbreaking development anytime soon because demand is just so poor and the price Wars are having a big impact on the revenue also they're spending more trying to invest in that next phase of growth it will likely pay off but again we're looking at two or three quarters probably before we start seeing it able to generate money from those advances if even then there's still no consensus among the analysts the analyst sentiment is very mixed there's a very wide range of sentiment targets from sell to buy and the price targets are equally wide so even if the stock doesn't move lower from here and stay lower I expect to see significant volatility and not much upper trend and in the action Chris do you think Tesla a sell right now too you know I find it hard to to say it's a sell and I think there's I'll admit there's the Elon Musk Factor there for me he's been counted out so many times and he tends to come back from the dead all these times I think in the short term it's hard for me to get behind Tesla stock in the long term I think a lot of the growth that investors are counting on is going to come from autonomous driving and Tesla is Leaps and Bounds ahead of other companies in terms of getting that to Market but there's still a big if attached to that can they get that done it's a stock that's just it's always going to be very noisy it's always going to be very polarizing um I I can't say I disagree with Thomas as cell but I would say to me it's probably one that you want to hold on to just in case right fear of out you never know all right [Music]

title: McDonald's Stock on the Verge of a Major Growth Comeback
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's on the cusp of pivoting back to growth very soon the forecasts for next year are very bullish which company you are looking to hold right now and why for my pick on stocks to hold I'm choosing McDonald's um Stock's up about 9% since it reported earnings in July and the report wasn't that good same store sales were down for the first time since 2020 and you'd have to go back a lot further than 2020 to find the last time that did it before then so this wasn't a great report and the stocks up 9% kind of feels to me like most of the growth has been priced in I like McDonald's I like the company it pays an attractive and growing dividend that I don't see being in any danger there's been a lot of talk about issues about demand and pricing and I don't think any of those issues are issues that a healthier economy and a healthier consumer won't fix it was investing in digital well before 2020 and that's paying off today all of that being said and going back to the rubric that you asked us to talk about at the beginning of how do we determine whether a Stock's a buy sell and a hold I think the next few quarters are going to be challenging for the company in terms of stock price growth it's trading at about 23 times forward earnings it was around 21 times forward earnings before the runup the analyst forecast on Market beat are a little bit more bullish about McDonald's than I am they have it as a moderate buy but the 9% runup on a challenging earnings report lends me to think that most of the growth at least in the short term is already priced into the stock Thomas where do you sit on McDonald's are you a McDonald's fan and especially a fan of what the company is doing right now uh well according to McDonald's internal data I'm a super heavy user I I do like McDonald's um I'm probably part of why the stock price keeps going up but right now uh the earnings report was a bit of a concern we don't want to see this company Contracting we certainly don't want to see a negative comp but what I think the results really show is the Diversified nature of the business because us was weak Latin America was banging Latin America is crushing it for a lot of different companies so I would definitely look in that direction for some Investments but as far as McDonald's goes it's on the cusp of pivoting back to growth very soon the forecasts for next year are very bullish the analysts have trimmed their targets since the last report but they're still looking at about 10 to 15% upside which puts the market back at the alltime High um any kind of good news will push it to a new all-time high and I think that could come with the fomc [Music]

title: CAVA Surges After Q2: Could It Be the Next Big Player in Fast-Casual Dining?
text: Kind: captions Language: en fast casual restaurants have seen tremendous growth in recent years but a newly public player is already blowing competitors away here to talk about the rising success of the Cava restaurant groups is marketbeat analyst juay Jay Cava is finishing out August incredibly strong oh yeah absolutely uh basically after earnings their shares shot up about 23% in the following days uh they really they really surprised everybody with their results because in the last quarter they only did 2.4% year-over-year same store sales growth this time around they pretty much blew away all their competitors um doing 14.4% year-over-year same store growth which is by comparison you know sweet green they did 9% year-over-year growth and uh their shares skyrocketed 30% on that chipot one up them and did 11. 1% year-over-year comp sales growth and then Cava came in and blew them away with 14.4% year-over-year comp comparable restaurant sales grow so they knocked it right out of the park that Grill story always gets investors attention and for a lot of people they may just have some firsthand experience with this Restaurant Group maybe like yourself I know you actually live really close to where the very first Cava restaurant went up so for those of us who might not be familiar kind of break down what this restaurant restant offers sure Tav is they call it the Chipotle of Mediterranean because it's one of those Garden style uh build it yourself assembly line um formats uh instead of uh like Mexican food these guys serve Mediterranean food um it's pretty much the same concept you pick your proteins your carbs um they've got 38 different toppings and uh dressings uh which basically you can have 17 billion com ations um and they're very colorful very colorful salades and they're very healthy they're locally sourced well that sounds awesome and also I think a trend there with these fast casual restaurants that offer something healthy something colorful they've seen a lot of success but what about kava's you know business plan really helps to set this restaurant apart and maybe lends to some of the success they're seeing well you know the thing about Cava especially being local to me is I've I've also noticed that they're uh they they tend to have the most upbeat happy employees um and I know it sounds cliche but for Cava uh they locally Source their talent meaning that they hire from inside and they have this thing called The Academy GM program where basically they will go ahead and train their top employees to eventually become uh GMS general managers and by harnessing this talent pool from within it keeps employees uh loyal and happy and upbeat because once you graduate that program you Cava wants to Source 75% of their General Managers from this program and as you graduate or you get out of there um and you continue to have this upward Mobility they want to eventually get uh get you a garden which is a cluster of eight Cava restaurants on top of that last year they bumped up their wages 8% and beefed up their health care uh all that basically sets the tone for the employees like I said they're like the most upbeat happy uh fast casual employees that I've ever come to engage with it's always nice to eat somewhere where the workers are just as happy as you are to be there um let's talk about there's a lot of opportunities for those Cava employees to also grow because there's so many new stores coming on they have a lot of locations right now right well actually cabba is actually early in its growth stage they only have 341 restaurants uh compare that to Chipotle which has over 3,47 70 restaurants so there's a lot of upside as far as the growth story is concerned uh which also leads me to you know when when people say that oh Travis stock price is so expensive don't forget Chipotle St was Trad in the 3500s before they split 50 to1 um and at that point they had 3,300 restaurants same thing with uh you know Caba it's very early in the story so uh they're going to continue to grow their restaurants um as far as their uh uh internal metrics this 14.4% year-over-year comp sales growth is it's top of the industry at this point it's they're outd doing Chipotle that's impressive alone uh now let's talk about what this all means for investors and you see all this potential growth for this Restaurant Group if you're an investor looking to get in what advice do you have Jay well obviously you shouldn't really be chasing stocks you should wait for some pullbacks and I know uh stock expensive just because it did bounce 23% in the past two days um but there's always opportunity there there's always going to be pullbacks cabba had formed a what's known as a bull flag breakout uh when it broke through 79 then it gapped up to the 110 area and then proceeded to go higher from there um eventually kava will pull back I think if you can get a pull back back to that 110 Gap fill area it's a good entry to to step back into the stock like I said there there's a they have a long uh Runway when it comes to growth very early in the story you know 10 times less this like one1 the size of a Chipotle well thank you for the Deep dive into this Restaurant Group we will continue to follow kava's growth story right here on Market beat as always happy investing [Music]

title: Top Stocks to Buy, Sell, and Hold Right Now
text: Kind: captions Language: en [Music] in the midst of all this volatility many investors are wondering what to buy what to sell and what to hold on to well our Market beat analysts Chris marot and concerned about what the stock might be doing in terms of technical movements at any one given moment in time but I'm looking at fundamental drivers for the business like Thomas said I'm looking for where's the growth going to come from how soon is it going to get here and is it growth that's going to be sustainable over the long term both of you have done a lot of that research right now and title: The Market is Watching: Why NVIDIAs Earnings Are Key
text: Kind: captions Language: en it's a week where all eyes are on Nvidia earnings reports come out on Wednesday and it's not just about Nvidia it's really about the market as a whole here to break down the impact this earnings report we have on the market is our Market beat analysts Chris marot and Thomas Hughes guys this is a really big week why is everyone so focused on this earnings report well Nvidia is the uh the central theme of the AI Revolution and the AI rally we've seen over the last two years it is amongst the most bought the most owned highly concentrated stocks in the S&P 500 right now we need to see a really good report for us to sustain the rally uh without a good report it's possible the entire Market could start to fall um so that's the concern we've really been rallying all summer Chris do you think nvidia's last earning report really had an impact on that summer rally when Nvidia reported earnings back in May nvidia's stock went up immediately after the port but the market didn't really chase after Nvidia it kind of was chopping along um what I think is really driving the overall market performance right now is clearly the fact that the Federal Reserve is going to be lowering interest rates uh drone PW made that very clear in the Jackson Hole speech he gave on Friday a 25 basis point cut is coming in September the market might like it to be 50 but they know it's going to be 25 that's why the market really shot higher on Friday I think that probably has more to do in the short term with what the market performance is going to be that's not to say Nvidia is not important for all the reasons that Thomas said but I think right now that the market has other things they're concentrating on the price of oil actually this morning being one of them um so I think it it's going to be interesting to see Nvidia I don't know if Nvidia actually acts the broader Market as much as we might think well it's only been maybe a year or so since Nvidia has really been leading the market the way it has been in such a big way with all of the big growth uh Thomas can you walk us through past earnings reports for NVIDIA when did they really start seeing such impressive growth that the whole Market really started to pay attention well they've been seeing this impressive growth for about two years uh the story over the last year is that growth accelerated from 100% to over 200% in that same time the Market's raising their expectations Nvidia continues to outperform expectations now the trend and results is really ridiculously good they're not only outperforming the consensus for the current quarter by 500 basis points but they're raising their guidance by 500 basis points above the consensus so that's like a double shot of accelerating good news which is leading the market higher and right now there's a very very high expectation for NVIDIA to continue continue that Trend just in the last two or three days the analysts have increased their estimates the consensus estimates for revenue and for earnings by like a thousand basis points so there really is a high expectation going into this report it really really needs to be a blowout report for it to keep the market moving higher what do this report coming up mean for AI as in the tech industry as a whole invid is really been that leader for at least the last couple of years what will this earnings report mean for that industry in particular well it'll tell us if the the chip Market is still expanding and still in that Discovery phase for how big it's going to get what we're really waiting for now is for the second wave of AI to take hold which is the companies that actually use AI to produce results for businesses um with Nvidia as a business they've expanded from just being a chip Pure Play into being a full stack AI play so we should be able to see that in their result we should be able to see that second wave of AI spending show up in their results as more companies lean into their services to help boost their own AI potential now Chris we've heard some talk this summer about the potential of an AI bubble and are we in a bubble are we priced too high for where this industry really is at uh what will nvidia's report on Wednesday say about the possibility of a bubble or not I know some people are using the term AI bubble I think that's because there's a lot of people that just don't know where we're at at in the AI cycle and I can't say for sure I know where we're at but I would say I think we're still closer to the beginning of the cycle than we are the end and probably even but but I think we're also closer to the middle of that cycle we're now investors want to see what companies are going to do with AI other than just say okay we're using generative AI as a chat bot or we're going to use generative AI as this that sort of is the T Stakes now they want to see what are companies going to be doing that are going to actually be changing the way these companies make decisions that are going to be leading to efficiencies within corporations and we haven't seen that yet which doesn't mean it's not coming but it just I think that's where a lot of the uncertainty is is just exactly where we are with AI all right so let's talk about Blackwell now this is another announcement that everyone is really waiting on and watching closely Nvidia is kind of known for making these really big announcements at earnings time are we expecting anything like that this time around Thomas um I wouldn't be surprised but I think right now the story with Blackwell is the potential for delays now I don't think that's a big problem for NVIDIA per se unless of course AMD is able to get its next gen chip to Market first and in that scenario that would supercharge the uh the market share gain potential for AMD and then that stock would probably take off like a rocket it's a lot for every industry to be watching right now and really everyone is watching and waiting for this Nvidia earnings report just one more time let's go over again why are so many eyes on this right now why can you find hundreds of Articles and video videos all talking about what is coming up with this Nvidia earnings report well Nvidia with AI has sparked a new Evolution in technology that's going to be worth hundreds of billions of dollars over time now over the last two years Nvidia has pretty much been the sole recipient of all of the spending all the goodness it's doubled its size more than once in the last few years it's doubled last year doubled this year and we're expecting that again so it's the stock almost everybody owns it if not specifically as an individual holding that in a fund or an ETF so it's got an impact on everybody's portfolio that's a lot for everyone to be watching and of course we will be watching Nvidia earnings report this Wednesday right here on Market beat happy investing everyone [Music]

title: Air Taxis by 2025? Archer Aviations Ambitious Plans and Stock Potential
text: Kind: captions Language: en well it's an idea straight out of a sci-fi movie but Archer Aviation is working to make air taxis a reality our Market be analyst jayu joins us to break down what's happening in this stock right now Jay I think everyone can get behind the idea of shortening your commute with an air taxi but just how close is Archer Aviation to actually making this a reality well they are basically looking to launch in 2025 um their key Flagship product is a an air taxi called the midnight technically called an avall electronic vertical takeoff and Landing aircraft it can carry four passengers and a pilot they can go 100 miles top speeds of 150 miles hour and they are actually setting up their networks as well setting up the LA Network and the San Francisco Network so they'll be ready to launch in 2025 and 2026 that is very soon and it all sounds exciting and fantastic but also very expensive just how much has Archer spent on developing this product in their last quarter they spent uh just over $92 million um now they have about 3 UH 60 million or so left in cash uh but they also have commitments uh from their Partners uh stantis for example these guys have already put up about $300 million and they've also committed to putting up another $39 to $400 million to get their manufacturing up and running these guys are the contract manufacturers so there's a lot of money pouring into pouring into this program yeah a lot of bigname investors coming behind this program but what does it mean for everyday investors who might be looking at Archer Aviation stock as a buy right now well Archer actually pulled back about 40% from last month so it offers a pretty decent opportunity to get in now keep in mind once again this is a speculative stock so this is a situation where you know they could run out of money even before they they launched their Network so it's very important to understand speculative but uh the $3 level is a very strong support $314 is basically where stellantis is in the stock a little over 17 million shares so if you get it in a pull on a pullback back to that area you know you're basically in the same position position as a Stant stellantis um and a lot cheaper than let's say your Kathy Wood uh of Arkin vest which owns 99.9% of the company with over 28 million shares at a higher price so what are analysts saying about the possible upside and some price targets for this stock moving forward right so basically it's hard to put an exact price Target on it right now it's just running on sentiment so this could hit double digits uh as we get close closer to the launch um there's going to be catalysts obviously so basically once they have their um FAA certification to actually start taking passengers that's going to make a big difference it's going to actually boost the stock up once they actually start uh you know having commercial commercial flights that's going to pump the stock up as well so there are stages where the stock should be able to continue to inch a little higher rally rally rally pull back you know hold based until it gets to the point where these guys are actually uh producing at full capacity but Jay what is this company mean for consumers who are looking for those quicker solutions for commuting in especially some of the largest cities like New York and La those are the people I'm thinking right now who are using helicopters to make that commute a lot shorter sure um so basically they want to shrink your commute time from 60 to 90 minutes by a car they want to shrink it down to about 10 minutes and you can imagine uh how many people would want to do that now it's cost prohibitive right now yes you could rent a helicopter in Manhattan you could use blade uh to travel from uh Manhattan to JFK in 10 minutes but it's going to cost you1 to2 a mile with air taxis they're trying to cut that down to $6 a mile by 202 2028 U they want to cut the price down to $2 a mile and then by 2030 and after they want to actually cut that price down to a dollar a mile so that's going to be a real benefit for consumers for everyday people who actually want to save on their commute times wow that's impressive it's also impressive to see some of the Catalyst already happening with this company with some of the big Partnerships they're already starting to get even before launching talk about those a little bit sure they so basically they've already collaborated with Southwest Airlines and United Airlines uh and putting together the Air Taxi Network um United has already committed conditional commitment to basically purchase a billion dollars the midnight aircraft uh future flight Global these guys have uh committed to buying well conditionally committed to buying about $580 Million worth the US Air Force has just taken delivery of their first aircraft so that they can basically test it out to see you know if they're going to order some more down the road there a lot of catalysts that are coming together almost to a perfect storm well we will no doubt continue to hear about this stock making headlines over the next few months and years as these new products are launched stick with marketbeat as we continue to follow what happens with archer Aviation and all stocks right at marketbeat.com as always happy investing [Music]

the last two years EPS is supposed to grow 137% so we're going to see some margin expansion with that leverage uh the trend is for outperformance uh but the analysts have had plenty of time to raise their targets so it's going to be a strong report it just depends on how much stronger than consensus it is if it kind of matches the consensus Target that would probably be among the worst case scenarios for near-term price because it means that all these gains have been priced in and we will most definitely see the price pull back at that point Thomas do you have those specifics real quick what kind of price targets are we looking at from analysts well right now we've got 44 analysts rating the stock at a moderate buy they're showing a pretty firm conviction that rating hasn't changed very much over the last year um right now the consensus Target is about $132 that's 15% above the 150-day moving average that's a pretty good Target for firm for Firm support and a nice trigger point for buying and selling if it were to be crossed um the consensus Target is rising most of the fresh um fresh targets are above consensus leading to a new a new all-time high so that is certainly a possibility but once again it's just going to come down to does the company perform as expected consensus is for 110% growth but the high end of the range is above that the whisper numbers are above that so the market is secretly expecting to have a strong result stronger than expected stronger than consensus has a pretty high bar to beat and Chris let's get into a little bit of what that high performance would look like for NVIDIA uh what are some things that investors are watching closely right now well one of the things that they're going to be looking for is an announcement or some clarity from Nvidia as far as when the launch of their Blackwell chip is coming out this is a chip that's going to be used more for um industrial slata center applications and the launch has been delayed and there is talk that it might get delayed from coming sometime in the last quarter of this year into 2025 investors are want to hear about that because that is something that could weigh in on the stocks performance not only for next quarter but in a couple of quarters after that also it introduces the idea that it gives other chip makers a chance to catch up now whether or not that's going to be a serious threat to Nvidia in the short term I don't know but it's something that you know it's something that investors are going to be listening for very carefully [Music]

title: Does Walmart and JD.com breakup create a buying opportunity?
text: Kind: captions Language: en while Amazon has dominated online shopping in the US for years there's another name for online shopping that's far more popular in China here to share more of what's behind jd.com Stellar earnings this quarter is Market beat analyst jayu Jay it sounds like jd.com is a very popular name in parts of Asia and Europe but for those of us who maybe don't know anything about this company what does jd.com offer well they're pretty much the Amazon of China so you can buy anything from know houseware to computers uh technology video games apparel what separates them from other sites like a Alibaba or a pendu or a teu is that you know these Chinese online sites Chinese products in general that have this reputation of being knockoffs uh of being cheap quality bait and switch stuff like that these are often the complaints people have with with a site like a teu um jd.com actively tries to change that with their authenticity guarantee so basically anything you buy there uh they are backing 100% that is not a counterfeit uh any any Merchants that do end up putting anything that's fake counterfeit on the site gets banned they get banned immediately and fined so they keep a very tight lid as far as the quality is concerned and it sounds like that's not the only product they off offer uh jd.com has several different uh branches right absolutely you know they call it the Amazon of China for many reasons just like Amazon jd.com has a number of Diversified businesses um you know they have uh online online pharmacy um they have their uh JD technology which does Cloud Computing Services uh AI so they're are they're on The Cutting Edge when it comes to technology now JD Logistics is Major these guys are the largest logistics company in China uh they have over 1,600 warehouses uh which together total more than 32 million square meters not feed square meters and they are on top of automation they are basically ahead of the curve they had their first automated Factory in 2018 where you would normally have uh four to 500 workers inside a 40,000 square meter facility uh that's been replaced by robots uh and you only need five people to run the operation uh and they could uh handle up to 200,000 orders a day wow I'm sure that Innovation is a large part of why this company is doing so well let's go through some of jd.com earnings report uh what's behind all the growth in this company right so their revenues only went up 1.2 % uh in the last quarter which almost sounds like they're not really growing that well but they they're net income Rose 69% year-over-year so you're talking $40 billion in revenues uh $2 billion in profits and it's it's they actually hit a record um that is the most they've ever made on in a quarter and it's it's only going to continue so what does that mean for the stock price what are we seeing jd.com stock do right now right so jd.com uh is relatively low low priced especially compared to a uh pendu duo or an Alibaba there's a very strong support on this one around 27 that's the daily 200 period moving average um the stock is starting to pull back a little bit so that would be a good opportunity for investors to consider getting into the stock um consensus price Target and uh analyst targets are around $37 sh so there's plenty of upside so Jay why is now a good time for investors to look at getting into jd.com they're continuing to grow their Logistics uh department is China's largest logistics company uh they've gotten it down to a science they can deliver to 2200 cities and provinces in China uh as fast as nine minutes to within an hour to a day to this to the next day delivery they have over 350,000 uh in-house workers uh with the logistics portion of the company they have a lot of big clients coming on board they have a lot of clients in Europe uh coming on board and like I said they are on top of the Cutting Edge when it comes to technology and automated robotic automated warehousing some great information thanks for the Deep dive into this company Jay we'll continue to follow this company and much more at marketbeat happy investing everyone [Music]
